Expected (11 differences)Actual (1 differences)

      <link href="../../resources/css/db-prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>

      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>

      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>All's Well That Ends Well</title>
   </head>
   <body>
      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>All's Well That Ends Well</h1>
         </header>

               </p>

         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">KING OF FRANCE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUKE OF FLORENCE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BERTRAM, Count of Rousillon.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LAFEU, an old lord.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PAROLLES, a follower of Bertram.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">Steward</span>
                        <span class="personname">Clown</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">servants to the Countess of Rousillon.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Page. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">COUNTESS OF ROUSILLON, mother to Bertram. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HELENA, a gentlewoman protected by the Countess.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">An old Widow of Florence. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DIANA, daughter to the Widow.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">VIOLENTA</span>
                        <span class="personname">MARIANA</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">neighbours and friends to the Widow.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lords, Officers, Soldiers, &c., French and Florentine.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Rousillon; Paris; Florence; Marseilles.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  Paris. The KING's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BERTRAM, the COUNTESS of Rousillon, HELENA,
and LAFEU, all in black</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">In delivering my son from me, I bury a second husband.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">And I in going, madam, weep o'er my father's death</div>
                     <div class="line">anew: but I must attend his majesty's command, to</div>
                     <div class="line">whom I am now in ward, evermore in subjection.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall find of the king a husband, madam; you,</div>
                     <div class="line">sir, a father: he that so generally is at all times</div>
                     <div class="line">good must of necessity hold his virtue to you; whose</div>
                     <div class="line">worthiness would stir it up where it wanted rather</div>
                     <div class="line">than lack it where there is such abundance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What hope is there of his majesty's amendment?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath abandoned his physicians, madam; under whose</div>
                     <div class="line">practises he hath persecuted time with hope, and</div>
                     <div class="line">finds no other advantage in the process but only the</div>
                     <div class="line">losing of hope by time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">This young gentlewoman had a father,--O, that</div>
                     <div class="line">'had'! how sad a passage 'tis!--whose skill was</div>
                     <div class="line">almost as great as his honesty; had it stretched so</div>
                     <div class="line">far, would have made nature immortal, and death</div>
                     <div class="line">should have play for lack of work. Would, for the</div>
                     <div class="line">king's sake, he were living! I think it would be</div>
                     <div class="line">the death of the king's disease.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">How called you the man you speak of, madam?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">He was famous, sir, in his profession, and it was</div>
                     <div class="line">his great right to be so: Gerard de Narbon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">He was excellent indeed, madam: the king very</div>
                     <div class="line">lately spoke of him admiringly and mourningly: he</div>
                     <div class="line">was skilful enough to have lived still, if knowledge</div>
                     <div class="line">could be set up against mortality.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What is it, my good lord, the king languishes of?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">A fistula, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I heard not of it before.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">I would it were not notorious. Was this gentlewoman</div>
                     <div class="line">the daughter of Gerard de Narbon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">His sole child, my lord, and bequeathed to my</div>
                     <div class="line">overlooking. I have those hopes of her good that</div>
                     <div class="line">her education promises; her dispositions she</div>
                     <div class="line">inherits, which makes fair gifts fairer; for where</div>
                     <div class="line">an unclean mind carries virtuous qualities, there</div>
                     <div class="line">commendations go with pity; they are virtues and</div>
                     <div class="line">traitors too; in her they are the better for their</div>
                     <div class="line">simpleness; she derives her honesty and achieves her goodness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Your commendations, madam, get from her tears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis the best brine a maiden can season her praise</div>
                     <div class="line">in. The remembrance of her father never approaches</div>
                     <div class="line">her heart but the tyranny of her sorrows takes all</div>
                     <div class="line">livelihood from her cheek. No more of this, Helena;</div>
                     <div class="line">go to, no more; lest it be rather thought you affect</div>
                     <div class="line">a sorrow than have it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">I do affect a sorrow indeed, but I have it too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Moderate lamentation is the right of the dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">excessive grief the enemy to the living.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">If the living be enemy to the grief, the excess</div>
                     <div class="line">makes it soon mortal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I desire your holy wishes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">How understand we that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thou blest, Bertram, and succeed thy father</div>
                     <div class="line">In manners, as in shape! thy blood and virtue</div>
                     <div class="line">Contend for empire in thee, and thy goodness</div>
                     <div class="line">Share with thy birthright! Love all, trust a few,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do wrong to none: be able for thine enemy</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather in power than use, and keep thy friend</div>
                     <div class="line">Under thy own life's key: be cheque'd for silence,</div>
                     <div class="line">But never tax'd for speech. What heaven more will,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thee may furnish and my prayers pluck down,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fall on thy head! Farewell, my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis an unseason'd courtier; good my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Advise him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">He cannot want the best</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall attend his love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven bless him! Farewell, Bertram.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To HELENA</span>  The best wishes that can be forged in</div>
                     <div class="line">your thoughts be servants to you! Be comfortable</div>
                     <div class="line">to my mother, your mistress, and make much of her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, pretty lady: you must hold the credit of</div>
                     <div class="line">your father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt BERTRAM and LAFEU</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, were that all! I think not on my father;</div>
                     <div class="line">And these great tears grace his remembrance more</div>
                     <div class="line">Than those I shed for him. What was he like?</div>
                     <div class="line">I have forgot him: my imagination</div>
                     <div class="line">Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am undone: there is no living, none,</div>
                     <div class="line">If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one</div>
                     <div class="line">That I should love a bright particular star</div>
                     <div class="line">And think to wed it, he is so above me:</div>
                     <div class="line">In his bright radiance and collateral light</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.</div>
                     <div class="line">The ambition in my love thus plagues itself:</div>
                     <div class="line">The hind that would be mated by the lion</div>
                     <div class="line">Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though plague,</div>
                     <div class="line">To see him every hour; to sit and draw</div>
                     <div class="line">His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,</div>
                     <div class="line">In our heart's table; heart too capable</div>
                     <div class="line">Of every line and trick of his sweet favour:</div>
                     <div class="line">But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy</div>
                     <div class="line">Must sanctify his reliques. Who comes here?</div>
                     <p>Enter PAROLLES</p>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">One that goes with him: I love him for his sake;</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I know him a notorious liar,</div>
                     <div class="line">Think him a great way fool, solely a coward;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet these fixed evils sit so fit in him,</div>
                     <div class="line">That they take place, when virtue's steely bones</div>
                     <div class="line">Look bleak i' the cold wind: withal, full oft we see</div>
                     <div class="line">Cold wisdom waiting on superfluous folly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Save you, fair queen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, monarch!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">No.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">And no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you meditating on virginity?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay. You have some stain of soldier in you: let me</div>
                     <div class="line">ask you a question. Man is enemy to virginity; how</div>
                     <div class="line">may we barricado it against him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep him out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">But he assails; and our virginity, though valiant,</div>
                     <div class="line">in the defence yet is weak: unfold to us some</div>
                     <div class="line">warlike resistance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">There is none: man, sitting down before you, will</div>
                     <div class="line">undermine you and blow you up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Bless our poor virginity from underminers and</div>
                     <div class="line">blowers up! Is there no military policy, how</div>
                     <div class="line">virgins might blow up men?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Virginity being blown down, man will quicklier be</div>
                     <div class="line">blown up: marry, in blowing him down again, with</div>
                     <div class="line">the breach yourselves made, you lose your city. It</div>
                     <div class="line">is not politic in the commonwealth of nature to</div>
                     <div class="line">preserve virginity. Loss of virginity is rational</div>
                     <div class="line">increase and there was never virgin got till</div>
                     <div class="line">virginity was first lost. That you were made of is</div>
                     <div class="line">metal to make virgins. Virginity by being once lost</div>
                     <div class="line">may be ten times found; by being ever kept, it is</div>
                     <div class="line">ever lost: 'tis too cold a companion; away with 't!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">I will stand for 't a little, though therefore I die a virgin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">There's little can be said in 't; 'tis against the</div>
                     <div class="line">rule of nature. To speak on the part of virginity,</div>
                     <div class="line">is to accuse your mothers; which is most infallible</div>
                     <div class="line">disobedience. He that hangs himself is a virgin:</div>
                     <div class="line">virginity murders itself and should be buried in</div>
                     <div class="line">highways out of all sanctified limit, as a desperate</div>
                     <div class="line">offendress against nature. Virginity breeds mites,</div>
                     <div class="line">much like a cheese; consumes itself to the very</div>
                     <div class="line">paring, and so dies with feeding his own stomach.</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, virginity is peevish, proud, idle, made of</div>
                     <div class="line">self-love, which is the most inhibited sin in the</div>
                     <div class="line">canon. Keep it not; you cannot choose but loose</div>
                     <div class="line">by't: out with 't! within ten year it will make</div>
                     <div class="line">itself ten, which is a goodly increase; and the</div>
                     <div class="line">principal itself not much the worse: away with 't!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">How might one do, sir, to lose it to her own liking?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me see: marry, ill, to like him that ne'er it</div>
                     <div class="line">likes. 'Tis a commodity will lose the gloss with</div>
                     <div class="line">lying; the longer kept, the less worth: off with 't</div>
                     <div class="line">while 'tis vendible; answer the time of request.</div>
                     <div class="line">Virginity, like an old courtier, wears her cap out</div>
                     <div class="line">of fashion: richly suited, but unsuitable: just</div>
                     <div class="line">like the brooch and the tooth-pick, which wear not</div>
                     <div class="line">now. Your date is better in your pie and your</div>
                     <div class="line">porridge than in your cheek; and your virginity,</div>
                     <div class="line">your old virginity, is like one of our French</div>
                     <div class="line">withered pears, it looks ill, it eats drily; marry,</div>
                     <div class="line">'tis a withered pear; it was formerly better;</div>
                     <div class="line">marry, yet 'tis a withered pear: will you anything with it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not my virginity yet</div>
                     <div class="line">There shall your master have a thousand loves,</div>
                     <div class="line">A mother and a mistress and a friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">A phoenix, captain and an enemy,</div>
                     <div class="line">A guide, a goddess, and a sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">A counsellor, a traitress, and a dear;</div>
                     <div class="line">His humble ambition, proud humility,</div>
                     <div class="line">His jarring concord, and his discord dulcet,</div>
                     <div class="line">His faith, his sweet disaster; with a world</div>
                     <div class="line">Of pretty, fond, adoptious christendoms,</div>
                     <div class="line">That blinking Cupid gossips. Now shall he--</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not what he shall. God send him well!</div>
                     <div class="line">The court's a learning place, and he is one--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">What one, i' faith?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">That I wish well. 'Tis pity--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">What's pity?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">That wishing well had not a body in't,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Might with effects of them follow our friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">And show what we alone must think, which never</div>
                     <div class="line">Return us thanks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Page</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">Monsieur Parolles, my lord calls for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Little Helen, farewell; if I can remember thee, I</div>
                     <div class="line">will think of thee at court.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Monsieur Parolles, you were born under a charitable star.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Under Mars, I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">I especially think, under Mars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Why under Mars?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">The wars have so kept you under that you must needs</div>
                     <div class="line">be born under Mars.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">When he was predominant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">When he was retrograde, I think, rather.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Why think you so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">You go so much backward when you fight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">That's for advantage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">So is running away, when fear proposes the safety;</div>
                     <div class="line">but the composition that your valour and fear makes</div>
                     <div class="line">in you is a virtue of a good wing, and I like the wear well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I am so full of businesses, I cannot answer thee</div>
                     <div class="line">acutely. I will return perfect courtier; in the</div>
                     <div class="line">which, my instruction shall serve to naturalize</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, so thou wilt be capable of a courtier's</div>
                     <div class="line">counsel and understand what advice shall thrust upon</div>
                     <div class="line">thee; else thou diest in thine unthankfulness, and</div>
                     <div class="line">thine ignorance makes thee away: farewell. When</div>
                     <div class="line">thou hast leisure, say thy prayers; when thou hast</div>
                     <div class="line">none, remember thy friends; get thee a good husband,</div>
                     <div class="line">and use him as he uses thee; so, farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we ascribe to heaven: the fated sky</div>
                     <div class="line">Gives us free scope, only doth backward pull</div>
                     <div class="line">Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.</div>
                     <div class="line">What power is it which mounts my love so high,</div>
                     <div class="line">That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?</div>
                     <div class="line">The mightiest space in fortune nature brings</div>
                     <div class="line">To join like likes and kiss like native things.</div>
                     <div class="line">Impossible be strange attempts to those</div>
                     <div class="line">That weigh their pains in sense and do suppose</div>
                     <div class="line">What hath been cannot be: who ever strove</div>
                     <div class="line">So show her merit, that did miss her love?</div>
                     <div class="line">The king's disease--my project may deceive me,</div>
                     <div class="line">But my intents are fix'd and will not leave me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Paris. The KING's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish of cornets. Enter the KING of France,
with letters, and divers Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">The Florentines and Senoys are by the ears;</div>
                     <div class="line">Have fought with equal fortune and continue</div>
                     <div class="line">A braving war.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">So 'tis reported, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, 'tis most credible; we here received it</div>
                     <div class="line">A certainty, vouch'd from our cousin Austria,</div>
                     <div class="line">With caution that the Florentine will move us</div>
                     <div class="line">For speedy aid; wherein our dearest friend</div>
                     <div class="line">Prejudicates the business and would seem</div>
                     <div class="line">To have us make denial.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">His love and wisdom,</div>
                     <div class="line">Approved so to your majesty, may plead</div>
                     <div class="line">For amplest credence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath arm'd our answer,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Florence is denied before he comes:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, for our gentlemen that mean to see</div>
                     <div class="line">The Tuscan service, freely have they leave</div>
                     <div class="line">To stand on either part.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">It well may serve</div>
                     <div class="line">A nursery to our gentry, who are sick</div>
                     <div class="line">For breathing and exploit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">What's he comes here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BERTRAM, LAFEU, and PAROLLES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the Count Rousillon, my good lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Young Bertram.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Youth, thou bear'st thy father's face;</div>
                     <div class="line">Frank nature, rather curious than in haste,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath well composed thee. Thy father's moral parts</div>
                     <div class="line">Mayst thou inherit too! Welcome to Paris.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My thanks and duty are your majesty's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">I would I had that corporal soundness now,</div>
                     <div class="line">As when thy father and myself in friendship</div>
                     <div class="line">First tried our soldiership! He did look far</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the service of the time and was</div>
                     <div class="line">Discipled of the bravest: he lasted long;</div>
                     <div class="line">But on us both did haggish age steal on</div>
                     <div class="line">And wore us out of act. It much repairs me</div>
                     <div class="line">To talk of your good father. In his youth</div>
                     <div class="line">He had the wit which I can well observe</div>
                     <div class="line">To-day in our young lords; but they may jest</div>
                     <div class="line">Till their own scorn return to them unnoted</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere they can hide their levity in honour;</div>
                     <div class="line">So like a courtier, contempt nor bitterness</div>
                     <div class="line">Were in his pride or sharpness; if they were,</div>
                     <div class="line">His equal had awaked them, and his honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Clock to itself, knew the true minute when</div>
                     <div class="line">Exception bid him speak, and at this time</div>
                     <div class="line">His tongue obey'd his hand: who were below him</div>
                     <div class="line">He used as creatures of another place</div>
                     <div class="line">And bow'd his eminent top to their low ranks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Making them proud of his humility,</div>
                     <div class="line">In their poor praise he humbled. Such a man</div>
                     <div class="line">Might be a copy to these younger times;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, follow'd well, would demonstrate them now</div>
                     <div class="line">But goers backward.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">His good remembrance, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lies richer in your thoughts than on his tomb;</div>
                     <div class="line">So in approof lives not his epitaph</div>
                     <div class="line">As in your royal speech.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Would I were with him! He would always say--</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks I hear him now; his plausive words</div>
                     <div class="line">He scatter'd not in ears, but grafted them,</div>
                     <div class="line">To grow there and to bear,--'Let me not live,'--</div>
                     <div class="line">This his good melancholy oft began,</div>
                     <div class="line">On the catastrophe and heel of pastime,</div>
                     <div class="line">When it was out,--'Let me not live,' quoth he,</div>
                     <div class="line">'After my flame lacks oil, to be the snuff</div>
                     <div class="line">Of younger spirits, whose apprehensive senses</div>
                     <div class="line">All but new things disdain; whose judgments are</div>
                     <div class="line">Mere fathers of their garments; whose constancies</div>
                     <div class="line">Expire before their fashions.' This he wish'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">I after him do after him wish too,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since I nor wax nor honey can bring home,</div>
                     <div class="line">I quickly were dissolved from my hive,</div>
                     <div class="line">To give some labourers room.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">You are loved, sir:</div>
                     <div class="line">They that least lend it you shall lack you first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">I fill a place, I know't. How long is't, count,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since the physician at your father's died?</div>
                     <div class="line">He was much famed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Some six months since, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">If he were living, I would try him yet.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lend me an arm; the rest have worn me out</div>
                     <div class="line">With several applications; nature and sickness</div>
                     <div class="line">Debate it at their leisure. Welcome, count;</div>
                     <div class="line">My son's no dearer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Thank your majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt. Flourish</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter COUNTESS, Steward, and Clown</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">I will now hear; what say you of this gentlewoman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Steward</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, the care I have had to even your content, I</div>
                     <div class="line">wish might be found in the calendar of my past</div>
                     <div class="line">endeavours; for then we wound our modesty and make</div>
                     <div class="line">foul the clearness of our deservings, when of</div>
                     <div class="line">ourselves we publish them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What does this knave here? Get you gone, sirrah:</div>
                     <div class="line">the complaints I have heard of you I do not all</div>
                     <div class="line">believe: 'tis my slowness that I do not; for I know</div>
                     <div class="line">you lack not folly to commit them, and have ability</div>
                     <div class="line">enough to make such knaveries yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not unknown to you, madam, I am a poor fellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">No, madam, 'tis not so well that I am poor, though</div>
                     <div class="line">many of the rich are damned: but, if I may have</div>
                     <div class="line">your ladyship's good will to go to the world, Isbel</div>
                     <div class="line">the woman and I will do as we may.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou needs be a beggar?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beg your good will in this case.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">In what case?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">In Isbel's case and mine own. Service is no</div>
                     <div class="line">heritage: and I think I shall never have the</div>
                     <div class="line">blessing of God till I have issue o' my body; for</div>
                     <div class="line">they say barnes are blessings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me thy reason why thou wilt marry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">My poor body, madam, requires it: I am driven on</div>
                     <div class="line">by the flesh; and he must needs go that the devil drives.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this all your worship's reason?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, madam, I have other holy reasons such as they</div>
                     <div class="line">are.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">May the world know them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I have been, madam, a wicked creature, as you and</div>
                     <div class="line">all flesh and blood are; and, indeed, I do marry</div>
                     <div class="line">that I may repent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy marriage, sooner than thy wickedness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I am out o' friends, madam; and I hope to have</div>
                     <div class="line">friends for my wife's sake.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Such friends are thine enemies, knave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">You're shallow, madam, in great friends; for the</div>
                     <div class="line">knaves come to do that for me which I am aweary of.</div>
                     <div class="line">He that ears my land spares my team and gives me</div>
                     <div class="line">leave to in the crop; if I be his cuckold, he's my</div>
                     <div class="line">drudge: he that comforts my wife is the cherisher</div>
                     <div class="line">of my flesh and blood; he that cherishes my flesh</div>
                     <div class="line">and blood loves my flesh and blood; he that loves my</div>
                     <div class="line">flesh and blood is my friend: ergo, he that kisses</div>
                     <div class="line">my wife is my friend. If men could be contented to</div>
                     <div class="line">be what they are, there were no fear in marriage;</div>
                     <div class="line">for young Charbon the Puritan and old Poysam the</div>
                     <div class="line">Papist, howsome'er their hearts are severed in</div>
                     <div class="line">religion, their heads are both one; they may jowl</div>
                     <div class="line">horns together, like any deer i' the herd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou ever be a foul-mouthed and calumnious knave?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">A prophet I, madam; and I speak the truth the next</div>
                     <div class="line">way:</div>
                     <div class="line">For I the ballad will repeat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which men full true shall find;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your marriage comes by destiny,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your cuckoo sings by kind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Get you gone, sir; I'll talk with you more anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Steward</div>
                     <div class="line">May it please you, madam, that he bid Helen come to</div>
                     <div class="line">you: of her I am to speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, tell my gentlewoman I would speak with her;</div>
                     <div class="line">Helen, I mean.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Was this fair face the cause, quoth she,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why the Grecians sacked Troy?</div>
                     <div class="line">Fond done, done fond,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was this King Priam's joy?</div>
                     <div class="line">With that she sighed as she stood,</div>
                     <div class="line">With that she sighed as she stood,</div>
                     <div class="line">And gave this sentence then;</div>
                     <div class="line">Among nine bad if one be good,</div>
                     <div class="line">Among nine bad if one be good,</div>
                     <div class="line">There's yet one good in ten.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, one good in ten? you corrupt the song, sirrah.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">One good woman in ten, madam; which is a purifying</div>
                     <div class="line">o' the song: would God would serve the world so all</div>
                     <div class="line">the year! we'ld find no fault with the tithe-woman,</div>
                     <div class="line">if I were the parson. One in ten, quoth a'! An we</div>
                     <div class="line">might have a good woman born but one every blazing</div>
                     <div class="line">star, or at an earthquake, 'twould mend the lottery</div>
                     <div class="line">well: a man may draw his heart out, ere a' pluck</div>
                     <div class="line">one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll be gone, sir knave, and do as I command you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">That man should be at woman's command, and yet no</div>
                     <div class="line">hurt done! Though honesty be no puritan, yet it</div>
                     <div class="line">will do no hurt; it will wear the surplice of</div>
                     <div class="line">humility over the black gown of a big heart. I am</div>
                     <div class="line">going, forsooth: the business is for Helen to come hither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Steward</div>
                     <div class="line">I know, madam, you love your gentlewoman entirely.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, I do: her father bequeathed her to me; and</div>
                     <div class="line">she herself, without other advantage, may lawfully</div>
                     <div class="line">make title to as much love as she finds: there is</div>
                     <div class="line">more owing her than is paid; and more shall be paid</div>
                     <div class="line">her than she'll demand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Steward</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I was very late more near her than I think</div>
                     <div class="line">she wished me: alone she was, and did communicate</div>
                     <div class="line">to herself her own words to her own ears; she</div>
                     <div class="line">thought, I dare vow for her, they touched not any</div>
                     <div class="line">stranger sense. Her matter was, she loved your son:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fortune, she said, was no goddess, that had put</div>
                     <div class="line">such difference betwixt their two estates; Love no</div>
                     <div class="line">god, that would not extend his might, only where</div>
                     <div class="line">qualities were level; Dian no queen of virgins, that</div>
                     <div class="line">would suffer her poor knight surprised, without</div>
                     <div class="line">rescue in the first assault or ransom afterward.</div>
                     <div class="line">This she delivered in the most bitter touch of</div>
                     <div class="line">sorrow that e'er I heard virgin exclaim in: which I</div>
                     <div class="line">held my duty speedily to acquaint you withal;</div>
                     <div class="line">sithence, in the loss that may happen, it concerns</div>
                     <div class="line">you something to know it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">You have discharged this honestly; keep it to</div>
                     <div class="line">yourself: many likelihoods informed me of this</div>
                     <div class="line">before, which hung so tottering in the balance that</div>
                     <div class="line">I could neither believe nor misdoubt. Pray you,</div>
                     <div class="line">leave me: stall this in your bosom; and I thank you</div>
                     <div class="line">for your honest care: I will speak with you further anon.</div>
                     <p>Exit Steward</p>
                     <p>Enter HELENA</p>
                     <div class="line">Even so it was with me when I was young:</div>
                     <div class="line">If ever we are nature's, these are ours; this thorn</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth to our rose of youth rightly belong;</div>
                     <div class="line">Our blood to us, this to our blood is born;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is the show and seal of nature's truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where love's strong passion is impress'd in youth:</div>
                     <div class="line">By our remembrances of days foregone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such were our faults, or then we thought them none.</div>
                     <div class="line">Her eye is sick on't: I observe her now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">What is your pleasure, madam?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">You know, Helen,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a mother to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine honourable mistress.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, a mother:</div>
                     <div class="line">Why not a mother? When I said 'a mother,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought you saw a serpent: what's in 'mother,'</div>
                     <div class="line">That you start at it? I say, I am your mother;</div>
                     <div class="line">And put you in the catalogue of those</div>
                     <div class="line">That were enwombed mine: 'tis often seen</div>
                     <div class="line">Adoption strives with nature and choice breeds</div>
                     <div class="line">A native slip to us from foreign seeds:</div>
                     <div class="line">You ne'er oppress'd me with a mother's groan,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet I express to you a mother's care:</div>
                     <div class="line">God's mercy, maiden! does it curd thy blood</div>
                     <div class="line">To say I am thy mother? What's the matter,</div>
                     <div class="line">That this distemper'd messenger of wet,</div>
                     <div class="line">The many-colour'd Iris, rounds thine eye?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why? that you are my daughter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, I am your mother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon, madam;</div>
                     <div class="line">The Count Rousillon cannot be my brother:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am from humble, he from honour'd name;</div>
                     <div class="line">No note upon my parents, his all noble:</div>
                     <div class="line">My master, my dear lord he is; and I</div>
                     <div class="line">His servant live, and will his vassal die:</div>
                     <div class="line">He must not be my brother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I your mother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">You are my mother, madam; would you were,--</div>
                     <div class="line">So that my lord your son were not my brother,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed my mother! or were you both our mothers,</div>
                     <div class="line">I care no more for than I do for heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">So I were not his sister. Can't no other,</div>
                     <div class="line">But, I your daughter, he must be my brother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, Helen, you might be my daughter-in-law:</div>
                     <div class="line">God shield you mean it not! daughter and mother</div>
                     <div class="line">So strive upon your pulse. What, pale again?</div>
                     <div class="line">My fear hath catch'd your fondness: now I see</div>
                     <div class="line">The mystery of your loneliness, and find</div>
                     <div class="line">Your salt tears' head: now to all sense 'tis gross</div>
                     <div class="line">You love my son; invention is ashamed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the proclamation of thy passion,</div>
                     <div class="line">To say thou dost not: therefore tell me true;</div>
                     <div class="line">But tell me then, 'tis so; for, look thy cheeks</div>
                     <div class="line">Confess it, th' one to th' other; and thine eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">See it so grossly shown in thy behaviors</div>
                     <div class="line">That in their kind they speak it: only sin</div>
                     <div class="line">And hellish obstinacy tie thy tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">That truth should be suspected. Speak, is't so?</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be so, you have wound a goodly clew;</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be not, forswear't: howe'er, I charge thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">As heaven shall work in me for thine avail,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me truly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good madam, pardon me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you love my son?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Your pardon, noble mistress!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Love you my son?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not you love him, madam?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go not about; my love hath in't a bond,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereof the world takes note: come, come, disclose</div>
                     <div class="line">The state of your affection; for your passions</div>
                     <div class="line">Have to the full appeach'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, I confess,</div>
                     <div class="line">Here on my knee, before high heaven and you,</div>
                     <div class="line">That before you, and next unto high heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">I love your son.</div>
                     <div class="line">My friends were poor, but honest; so's my love:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not offended; for it hurts not him</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is loved of me: I follow him not</div>
                     <div class="line">By any token of presumptuous suit;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor would I have him till I do deserve him;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet never know how that desert should be.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know I love in vain, strive against hope;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet in this captious and intenible sieve</div>
                     <div class="line">I still pour in the waters of my love</div>
                     <div class="line">And lack not to lose still: thus, Indian-like,</div>
                     <div class="line">Religious in mine error, I adore</div>
                     <div class="line">The sun, that looks upon his worshipper,</div>
                     <div class="line">But knows of him no more. My dearest madam,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not your hate encounter with my love</div>
                     <div class="line">For loving where you do: but if yourself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose aged honour cites a virtuous youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did ever in so true a flame of liking</div>
                     <div class="line">Wish chastely and love dearly, that your Dian</div>
                     <div class="line">Was both herself and love: O, then, give pity</div>
                     <div class="line">To her, whose state is such that cannot choose</div>
                     <div class="line">But lend and give where she is sure to lose;</div>
                     <div class="line">That seeks not to find that her search implies,</div>
                     <div class="line">But riddle-like lives sweetly where she dies!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Had you not lately an intent,--speak truly,--</div>
                     <div class="line">To go to Paris?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I had.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore? tell true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">I will tell truth; by grace itself I swear.</div>
                     <div class="line">You know my father left me some prescriptions</div>
                     <div class="line">Of rare and proved effects, such as his reading</div>
                     <div class="line">And manifest experience had collected</div>
                     <div class="line">For general sovereignty; and that he will'd me</div>
                     <div class="line">In heedfull'st reservation to bestow them,</div>
                     <div class="line">As notes whose faculties inclusive were</div>
                     <div class="line">More than they were in note: amongst the rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a remedy, approved, set down,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cure the desperate languishings whereof</div>
                     <div class="line">The king is render'd lost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">This was your motive</div>
                     <div class="line">For Paris, was it? speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord your son made me to think of this;</div>
                     <div class="line">Else Paris and the medicine and the king</div>
                     <div class="line">Had from the conversation of my thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">Haply been absent then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">But think you, Helen,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you should tender your supposed aid,</div>
                     <div class="line">He would receive it? he and his physicians</div>
                     <div class="line">Are of a mind; he, that they cannot help him,</div>
                     <div class="line">They, that they cannot help: how shall they credit</div>
                     <div class="line">A poor unlearned virgin, when the schools,</div>
                     <div class="line">Embowell'd of their doctrine, have left off</div>
                     <div class="line">The danger to itself?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">There's something in't,</div>
                     <div class="line">More than my father's skill, which was the greatest</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his profession, that his good receipt</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall for my legacy be sanctified</div>
                     <div class="line">By the luckiest stars in heaven: and, would your honour</div>
                     <div class="line">But give me leave to try success, I'ld venture</div>
                     <div class="line">The well-lost life of mine on his grace's cure</div>
                     <div class="line">By such a day and hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou believe't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, madam, knowingly.</div>
