               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Monsieur Parolles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I believe with him,</div>
                     <div class="line">In argument of praise, or to the worth</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the great count himself, she is too mean</div>
                     <div class="line">To have her name repeated: all her deserving</div>
                     <div class="line">Is a reserved honesty, and that</div>
                     <div class="line">I have not heard examined.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor lady!</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis a hard bondage to become the wife</div>
                     <div class="line">Of a detesting lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">I warrant, good creature, wheresoe'er she is,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her heart weighs sadly: this young maid might do her</div>
                     <div class="line">A shrewd turn, if she pleased.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">How do you mean?</div>
                     <div class="line">May be the amorous count solicits her</div>
                     <div class="line">In the unlawful purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">He does indeed;</div>
                     <div class="line">And brokes with all that can in such a suit</div>
                     <div class="line">Corrupt the tender honour of a maid:</div>
                     <div class="line">But she is arm'd for him and keeps her guard</div>
                     <div class="line">In honestest defence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">The gods forbid else!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">So, now they come:</div>
                     <p>Drum and Colours</p>
                     <p>Enter BERTRAM, PAROLLES, and the whole army</p>
                     <div class="line">That is Antonio, the duke's eldest son;</div>
                     <div class="line">That, Escalus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is the Frenchman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">He;</div>
                     <div class="line">That with the plume: 'tis a most gallant fellow.</div>
                     <div class="line">I would he loved his wife: if he were honester</div>
                     <div class="line">He were much goodlier: is't not a handsome gentleman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">I like him well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis pity he is not honest: yond's that same knave</div>
                     <div class="line">That leads him to these places: were I his lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would Poison that vile rascal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">That jack-an-apes with scarfs: why is he melancholy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Perchance he's hurt i' the battle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Lose our drum! well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">He's shrewdly vexed at something: look, he has spied us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, hang you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">And your courtesy, for a ring-carrier!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt BERTRAM, PAROLLES, and army</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">The troop is past. Come, pilgrim, I will bring you</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you shall host: of enjoin'd penitents</div>
                     <div class="line">There's four or five, to great Saint Jaques bound,</div>
                     <div class="line">Already at my house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">I humbly thank you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Please it this matron and this gentle maid</div>
                     <div class="line">To eat with us to-night, the charge and thanking</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be for me; and, to requite you further,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will bestow some precepts of this virgin</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthy the note.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll take your offer kindly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  Camp before Florence.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BERTRAM and the two French Lords</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, good my lord, put him to't; let him have his</div>
                     <div class="line">way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">If your lordship find him not a hilding, hold me no</div>
                     <div class="line">more in your respect.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">On my life, my lord, a bubble.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you think I am so far deceived in him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe it, my lord, in mine own direct knowledge,</div>
                     <div class="line">without any malice, but to speak of him as my</div>
                     <div class="line">kinsman, he's a most notable coward, an infinite and</div>
                     <div class="line">endless liar, an hourly promise-breaker, the owner</div>
                     <div class="line">of no one good quality worthy your lordship's</div>
                     <div class="line">entertainment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">It were fit you knew him; lest, reposing too far in</div>
                     <div class="line">his virtue, which he hath not, he might at some</div>
                     <div class="line">great and trusty business in a main danger fail you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I would I knew in what particular action to try him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">None better than to let him fetch off his drum,</div>
                     <div class="line">which you hear him so confidently undertake to do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I, with a troop of Florentines, will suddenly</div>
                     <div class="line">surprise him; such I will have, whom I am sure he</div>
                     <div class="line">knows not from the enemy: we will bind and hoodwink</div>
                     <div class="line">him so, that he shall suppose no other but that he</div>
                     <div class="line">is carried into the leaguer of the adversaries, when</div>
                     <div class="line">we bring him to our own tents. Be but your lordship</div>
                     <div class="line">present at his examination: if he do not, for the</div>
                     <div class="line">promise of his life and in the highest compulsion of</div>
                     <div class="line">base fear, offer to betray you and deliver all the</div>
                     <div class="line">intelligence in his power against you, and that with</div>
                     <div class="line">the divine forfeit of his soul upon oath, never</div>
                     <div class="line">trust my judgment in any thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">O, for the love of laughter, let him fetch his drum;</div>
                     <div class="line">he says he has a stratagem for't: when your</div>
                     <div class="line">lordship sees the bottom of his success in't, and to</div>
                     <div class="line">what metal this counterfeit lump of ore will be</div>
                     <div class="line">melted, if you give him not John Drum's</div>
                     <div class="line">entertainment, your inclining cannot be removed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here he comes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PAROLLES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to BERTRAM</span>  O, for the love of laughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">hinder not the honour of his design: let him fetch</div>
                     <div class="line">off his drum in any hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, monsieur! this drum sticks sorely in your</div>
                     <div class="line">disposition.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">A pox on't, let it go; 'tis but a drum.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">'But a drum'! is't 'but a drum'? A drum so lost!</div>
                     <div class="line">There was excellent command,--to charge in with our</div>
                     <div class="line">horse upon our own wings, and to rend our own soldiers!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">That was not to be blamed in the command of the</div>
                     <div class="line">service: it was a disaster of war that Caesar</div>
                     <div class="line">himself could not have prevented, if he had been</div>
                     <div class="line">there to command.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, we cannot greatly condemn our success: some</div>
                     <div class="line">dishonour we had in the loss of that drum; but it is</div>
                     <div class="line">not to be recovered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">It might have been recovered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">It might; but it is not now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">It is to be recovered: but that the merit of</div>
                     <div class="line">service is seldom attributed to the true and exact</div>
                     <div class="line">performer, I would have that drum or another, or</div>
                     <div class="line">'hic jacet.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, if you have a stomach, to't, monsieur: if you</div>
                     <div class="line">think your mystery in stratagem can bring this</div>
                     <div class="line">instrument of honour again into his native quarter,</div>
                     <div class="line">be magnanimous in the enterprise and go on; I will</div>
                     <div class="line">grace the attempt for a worthy exploit: if you</div>
                     <div class="line">speed well in it, the duke shall both speak of it.</div>
                     <div class="line">and extend to you what further becomes his</div>
                     <div class="line">greatness, even to the utmost syllable of your</div>
                     <div class="line">worthiness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">By the hand of a soldier, I will undertake it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">But you must not now slumber in it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll about it this evening: and I will presently</div>
                     <div class="line">pen down my dilemmas, encourage myself in my</div>
                     <div class="line">certainty, put myself into my mortal preparation;</div>
                     <div class="line">and by midnight look to hear further from me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">May I be bold to acquaint his grace you are gone about it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not what the success will be, my lord; but</div>
                     <div class="line">the attempt I vow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I know thou'rt valiant; and, to the possibility of</div>
                     <div class="line">thy soldiership, will subscribe for thee. Farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I love not many words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">No more than a fish loves water. Is not this a</div>
                     <div class="line">strange fellow, my lord, that so confidently seems</div>
                     <div class="line">to undertake this business, which he knows is not to</div>
                     <div class="line">be done; damns himself to do and dares better be</div>
                     <div class="line">damned than to do't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">You do not know him, my lord, as we do: certain it</div>
                     <div class="line">is that he will steal himself into a man's favour and</div>
                     <div class="line">for a week escape a great deal of discoveries; but</div>
                     <div class="line">when you find him out, you have him ever after.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, do you think he will make no deed at all of</div>
                     <div class="line">this that so seriously he does address himself unto?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">None in the world; but return with an invention and</div>
                     <div class="line">clap upon you two or three probable lies: but we</div>
                     <div class="line">have almost embossed him; you shall see his fall</div>
                     <div class="line">to-night; for indeed he is not for your lordship's respect.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll make you some sport with the fox ere we case</div>
                     <div class="line">him. He was first smoked by the old lord Lafeu:</div>
                     <div class="line">when his disguise and he is parted, tell me what a</div>
                     <div class="line">sprat you shall find him; which you shall see this</div>
                     <div class="line">very night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I must go look my twigs: he shall be caught.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Your brother he shall go along with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">As't please your lordship: I'll leave you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Now will I lead you to the house, and show you</div>
                     <div class="line">The lass I spoke of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">But you say she's honest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">That's all the fault: I spoke with her but once</div>
                     <div class="line">And found her wondrous cold; but I sent to her,</div>
                     <div class="line">By this same coxcomb that we have i' the wind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tokens and letters which she did re-send;</div>
                     <div class="line">And this is all I have done. She's a fair creature:</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you go see her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my heart, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Florence. The Widow's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HELENA and Widow</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">If you misdoubt me that I am not she,</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not how I shall assure you further,</div>
                     <div class="line">But I shall lose the grounds I work upon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">Though my estate be fallen, I was well born,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing acquainted with these businesses;</div>
                     <div class="line">And would not put my reputation now</div>
                     <div class="line">In any staining act.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor would I wish you.</div>
                     <div class="line">First, give me trust, the count he is my husband,</div>
                     <div class="line">And what to your sworn counsel I have spoken</div>
                     <div class="line">Is so from word to word; and then you cannot,</div>
                     <div class="line">By the good aid that I of you shall borrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Err in bestowing it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">I should believe you:</div>
                     <div class="line">For you have show'd me that which well approves</div>
                     <div class="line">You're great in fortune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Take this purse of gold,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let me buy your friendly help thus far,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I will over-pay and pay again</div>
                     <div class="line">When I have found it. The count he wooes your daughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lays down his wanton siege before her beauty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Resolved to carry her: let her in fine consent,</div>
                     <div class="line">As we'll direct her how 'tis best to bear it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now his important blood will nought deny</div>
                     <div class="line">That she'll demand: a ring the county wears,</div>
                     <div class="line">That downward hath succeeded in his house</div>
                     <div class="line">From son to son, some four or five descents</div>
                     <div class="line">Since the first father wore it: this ring he holds</div>
                     <div class="line">In most rich choice; yet in his idle fire,</div>
                     <div class="line">To buy his will, it would not seem too dear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Howe'er repented after.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">Now I see</div>
                     <div class="line">The bottom of your purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">You see it lawful, then: it is no more,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that your daughter, ere she seems as won,</div>
                     <div class="line">Desires this ring; appoints him an encounter;</div>
                     <div class="line">In fine, delivers me to fill the time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Herself most chastely absent: after this,</div>
                     <div class="line">To marry her, I'll add three thousand crowns</div>
                     <div class="line">To what is passed already.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">I have yielded:</div>
                     <div class="line">Instruct my daughter how she shall persever,</div>
                     <div class="line">That time and place with this deceit so lawful</div>
                     <div class="line">May prove coherent. Every night he comes</div>
                     <div class="line">With musics of all sorts and songs composed</div>
                     <div class="line">To her unworthiness: it nothing steads us</div>
                     <div class="line">To chide him from our eaves; for he persists</div>
                     <div class="line">As if his life lay on't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then to-night</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us assay our plot; which, if it speed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is wicked meaning in a lawful deed</div>
                     <div class="line">And lawful meaning in a lawful act,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where both not sin, and yet a sinful fact:</div>
                     <div class="line">But let's about it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  Florence. The Widow's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Second French Lord, with five or six other
Soldiers in ambush</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">He can come no other way but by this hedge-corner.</div>
                     <div class="line">When you sally upon him, speak what terrible</div>
                     <div class="line">language you will: though you understand it not</div>
                     <div class="line">yourselves, no matter; for we must not seem to</div>
                     <div class="line">understand him, unless some one among us whom we</div>
                     <div class="line">must produce for an interpreter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Good captain, let me be the interpreter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Art not acquainted with him? knows he not thy voice?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir, I warrant you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">But what linsey-woolsey hast thou to speak to us again?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">E'en such as you speak to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">He must think us some band of strangers i' the</div>
                     <div class="line">adversary's entertainment. Now he hath a smack of</div>
                     <div class="line">all neighbouring languages; therefore we must every</div>
                     <div class="line">one be a man of his own fancy, not to know what we</div>
                     <div class="line">speak one to another; so we seem to know, is to</div>
                     <div class="line">know straight our purpose: choughs' language,</div>
                     <div class="line">gabble enough, and good enough. As for you,</div>
                     <div class="line">interpreter, you must seem very politic. But couch,</div>
                     <div class="line">ho! here he comes, to beguile two hours in a sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">and then to return and swear the lies he forges.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PAROLLES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Ten o'clock: within these three hours 'twill be</div>
                     <div class="line">time enough to go home. What shall I say I have</div>
                     <div class="line">done? It must be a very plausive invention that</div>
                     <div class="line">carries it: they begin to smoke me; and disgraces</div>
                     <div class="line">have of late knocked too often at my door. I find</div>
                     <div class="line">my tongue is too foolhardy; but my heart hath the</div>
                     <div class="line">fear of Mars before it and of his creatures, not</div>
                     <div class="line">daring the reports of my tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the first truth that e'er thine own tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">was guilty of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">What the devil should move me to undertake the</div>
                     <div class="line">recovery of this drum, being not ignorant of the</div>
                     <div class="line">impossibility, and knowing I had no such purpose? I</div>
                     <div class="line">must give myself some hurts, and say I got them in</div>
                     <div class="line">exploit: yet slight ones will not carry it; they</div>
                     <div class="line">will say, 'Came you off with so little?' and great</div>
                     <div class="line">ones I dare not give. Wherefore, what's the</div>
                     <div class="line">instance? Tongue, I must put you into a</div>
                     <div class="line">butter-woman's mouth and buy myself another of</div>
                     <div class="line">Bajazet's mule, if you prattle me into these perils.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it possible he should know what he is, and be</div>
                     <div class="line">that he is?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I would the cutting of my garments would serve the</div>
                     <div class="line">turn, or the breaking of my Spanish sword.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot afford you so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Or the baring of my beard; and to say it was in</div>
                     <div class="line">stratagem.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twould not do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Or to drown my clothes, and say I was stripped.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Hardly serve.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Though I swore I leaped from the window of the citadel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">How deep?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Thirty fathom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Three great oaths would scarce make that be believed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I would I had any drum of the enemy's: I would swear</div>
                     <div class="line">I recovered it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall hear one anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">A drum now of the enemy's,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Throca movousus, cargo, cargo, cargo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">All</div>
                     <div class="line">Cargo, cargo, cargo, villiando par corbo, cargo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">O, ransom, ransom! do not hide mine eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>They seize and blindfold him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Boskos thromuldo boskos.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you are the Muskos' regiment:</div>
                     <div class="line">And I shall lose my life for want of language;</div>
                     <div class="line">If there be here German, or Dane, low Dutch,</div>
                     <div class="line">Italian, or French, let him speak to me; I'll</div>
                     <div class="line">Discover that which shall undo the Florentine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Boskos vauvado: I understand thee, and can speak</div>
                     <div class="line">thy tongue. Kerely bonto, sir, betake thee to thy</div>
                     <div class="line">faith, for seventeen poniards are at thy bosom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">O!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">O, pray, pray, pray! Manka revania dulche.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Oscorbidulchos volivorco.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">The general is content to spare thee yet;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, hoodwink'd as thou art, will lead thee on</div>
                     <div class="line">To gather from thee: haply thou mayst inform</div>
                     <div class="line">Something to save thy life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me live!</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the secrets of our camp I'll show,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their force, their purposes; nay, I'll speak that</div>
                     <div class="line">Which you will wonder at.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">But wilt thou faithfully?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">If I do not, damn me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Acordo linta.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come on; thou art granted space.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit, with PAROLLES guarded. A short alarum within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, tell the Count Rousillon, and my brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">We have caught the woodcock, and will keep him muffled</div>
                     <div class="line">Till we do hear from them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Captain, I will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">A' will betray us all unto ourselves:</div>
                     <div class="line">Inform on that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">So I will, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Till then I'll keep him dark and safely lock'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BERTRAM and DIANA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">They told me that your name was Fontibell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my good lord, Diana.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Titled goddess;</div>
                     <div class="line">And worth it, with addition! But, fair soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">In your fine frame hath love no quality?</div>
                     <div class="line">If quick fire of youth light not your mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are no maiden, but a monument:</div>
                     <div class="line">When you are dead, you should be such a one</div>
                     <div class="line">As you are now, for you are cold and stem;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now you should be as your mother was</div>
                     <div class="line">When your sweet self was got.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">She then was honest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">So should you be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">No:</div>
                     <div class="line">My mother did but duty; such, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">As you owe to your wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">No more o' that;</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, do not strive against my vows:</div>
                     <div class="line">I was compell'd to her; but I love thee</div>
                     <div class="line">By love's own sweet constraint, and will for ever</div>
                     <div class="line">Do thee all rights of service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, so you serve us</div>
                     <div class="line">Till we serve you; but when you have our roses,</div>
                     <div class="line">You barely leave our thorns to prick ourselves</div>
                     <div class="line">And mock us with our bareness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">How have I sworn!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not the many oaths that makes the truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">But the plain single vow that is vow'd true.</div>
                     <div class="line">What is not holy, that we swear not by,</div>
                     <div class="line">But take the High'st to witness: then, pray you, tell me,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I should swear by God's great attributes,</div>
                     <div class="line">I loved you dearly, would you believe my oaths,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I did love you ill? This has no holding,</div>
                     <div class="line">To swear by him whom I protest to love,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I will work against him: therefore your oaths</div>
                     <div class="line">Are words and poor conditions, but unseal'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">At least in my opinion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Change it, change it;</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not so holy-cruel: love is holy;</div>
                     <div class="line">And my integrity ne'er knew the crafts</div>
                     <div class="line">That you do charge men with. Stand no more off,</div>
                     <div class="line">But give thyself unto my sick desires,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who then recover: say thou art mine, and ever</div>
                     <div class="line">My love as it begins shall so persever.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I see that men make ropes in such a scarre</div>
                     <div class="line">That we'll forsake ourselves. Give me that ring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll lend it thee, my dear; but have no power</div>
                     <div class="line">To give it from me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you not, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">It is an honour 'longing to our house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bequeathed down from many ancestors;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which were the greatest obloquy i' the world</div>
                     <div class="line">In me to lose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine honour's such a ring:</div>
                     <div class="line">My chastity's the jewel of our house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bequeathed down from many ancestors;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which were the greatest obloquy i' the world</div>
                     <div class="line">In me to lose: thus your own proper wisdom</div>
                     <div class="line">Brings in the champion Honour on my part,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against your vain assault.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, take my ring:</div>
                     <div class="line">My house, mine honour, yea, my life, be thine,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll be bid by thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">When midnight comes, knock at my chamber-window:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll order take my mother shall not hear.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now will I charge you in the band of truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">When you have conquer'd my yet maiden bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Remain there but an hour, nor speak to me:</div>
                     <div class="line">My reasons are most strong; and you shall know them</div>
                     <div class="line">When back again this ring shall be deliver'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">And on your finger in the night I'll put</div>
                     <div class="line">Another ring, that what in time proceeds</div>
                     <div class="line">May token to the future our past deeds.</div>
                     <div class="line">Adieu, till then; then, fail not. You have won</div>
                     <div class="line">A wife of me, though there my hope be done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">A heaven on earth I have won by wooing thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">For which live long to thank both heaven and me!</div>
                     <div class="line">You may so in the end.</div>
                     <div class="line">My mother told me just how he would woo,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if she sat in 's heart; she says all men</div>
                     <div class="line">Have the like oaths: he had sworn to marry me</div>
                     <div class="line">When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him</div>
                     <div class="line">When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry that will, I live and die a maid:</div>
                     <div class="line">Only in this disguise I think't no sin</div>
                     <div class="line">To cozen him that would unjustly win.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the two French Lords and some two or three Soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">You have not given him his mother's letter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I have delivered it an hour since: there is</div>
                     <div class="line">something in't that stings his nature; for on the</div>
                     <div class="line">reading it he changed almost into another man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">He has much worthy blame laid upon him for shaking</div>
                     <div class="line">off so good a wife and so sweet a lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Especially he hath incurred the everlasting</div>
                     <div class="line">displeasure of the king, who had even tuned his</div>
                     <div class="line">bounty to sing happiness to him. I will tell you a</div>
                     <div class="line">thing, but you shall let it dwell darkly with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">When you have spoken it, 'tis dead, and I am the</div>
                     <div class="line">grave of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath perverted a young gentlewoman here in</div>
                     <div class="line">Florence, of a most chaste renown; and this night he</div>
                     <div class="line">fleshes his will in the spoil of her honour: he hath</div>
                     <div class="line">given her his monumental ring, and thinks himself</div>
                     <div class="line">made in the unchaste composition.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, God delay our rebellion! as we are ourselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">what things are we!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Merely our own traitors. And as in the common course</div>
                     <div class="line">of all treasons, we still see them reveal</div>
                     <div class="line">themselves, till they attain to their abhorred ends,</div>
                     <div class="line">so he that in this action contrives against his own</div>
                     <div class="line">nobility, in his proper stream o'erflows himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it not meant damnable in us, to be trumpeters of</div>
                     <div class="line">our unlawful intents? We shall not then have his</div>
                     <div class="line">company to-night?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Not till after midnight; for he is dieted to his hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">That approaches apace; I would gladly have him see</div>
                     <div class="line">his company anatomized, that he might take a measure</div>
                     <div class="line">of his own judgments, wherein so curiously he had</div>
                     <div class="line">set this counterfeit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">We will not meddle with him till he come; for his</div>
                     <div class="line">presence must be the whip of the other.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">In the mean time, what hear you of these wars?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I hear there is an overture of peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I assure you, a peace concluded.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">What will Count Rousillon do then? will he travel</div>
                     <div class="line">higher, or return again into France?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I perceive, by this demand, you are not altogether</div>
                     <div class="line">of his council.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be forbid, sir; so should I be a great deal</div>
                     <div class="line">of his act.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, his wife some two months since fled from his</div>
                     <div class="line">house: her pretence is a pilgrimage to Saint Jaques</div>
                     <div class="line">le Grand; which holy undertaking with most austere</div>
                     <div class="line">sanctimony she accomplished; and, there residing the</div>
                     <div class="line">tenderness of her nature became as a prey to her</div>
                     <div class="line">grief; in fine, made a groan of her last breath, and</div>
                     <div class="line">now she sings in heaven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">How is this justified?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">The stronger part of it by her own letters, which</div>
                     <div class="line">makes her story true, even to the point of her</div>
                     <div class="line">death: her death itself, which could not be her</div>
                     <div class="line">office to say is come, was faithfully confirmed by</div>
                     <div class="line">the rector of the place.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath the count all this intelligence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and the particular confirmations, point from</div>
                     <div class="line">point, so to the full arming of the verity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I am heartily sorry that he'll be glad of this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">How mightily sometimes we make us comforts of our losses!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">And how mightily some other times we drown our gain</div>
                     <div class="line">in tears! The great dignity that his valour hath</div>
                     <div class="line">here acquired for him shall at home be encountered</div>
                     <div class="line">with a shame as ample.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">The web of our life is of a mingled yarn, good and</div>
                     <div class="line">ill together: our virtues would be proud, if our</div>
                     <div class="line">faults whipped them not; and our crimes would</div>
                     <div class="line">despair, if they were not cherished by our virtues.</div>
                     <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                     <div class="line">How now! where's your master?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">He met the duke in the street, sir, of whom he hath</div>
                     <div class="line">taken a solemn leave: his lordship will next</div>
                     <div class="line">morning for France. The duke hath offered him</div>
                     <div class="line">letters of commendations to the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">They shall be no more than needful there, if they</div>
                     <div class="line">were more than they can commend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">They cannot be too sweet for the king's tartness.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's his lordship now.</div>
                     <p>Enter BERTRAM</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, my lord! is't not after midnight?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I have to-night dispatched sixteen businesses, a</div>
                     <div class="line">month's length a-piece, by an abstract of success:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have congied with the duke, done my adieu with his</div>
                     <div class="line">nearest; buried a wife, mourned for her; writ to my</div>
                     <div class="line">lady mother I am returning; entertained my convoy;</div>
                     <div class="line">and between these main parcels of dispatch effected</div>
                     <div class="line">many nicer needs; the last was the greatest, but</div>
                     <div class="line">that I have not ended yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">If the business be of any difficulty, and this</div>
                     <div class="line">morning your departure hence, it requires haste of</div>
                     <div class="line">your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, the business is not ended, as fearing to</div>
                     <div class="line">hear of it hereafter. But shall we have this</div>
                     <div class="line">dialogue between the fool and the soldier? Come,</div>
                     <div class="line">bring forth this counterfeit module, he has deceived</div>
                     <div class="line">me, like a double-meaning prophesier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring him forth: has sat i' the stocks all night,</div>
                     <div class="line">poor gallant knave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">No matter: his heels have deserved it, in usurping</div>
                     <div class="line">his spurs so long. How does he carry himself?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I have told your lordship already, the stocks carry</div>
                     <div class="line">him. But to answer you as you would be understood;</div>
                     <div class="line">he weeps like a wench that had shed her milk: he</div>
                     <div class="line">hath confessed himself to Morgan, whom he supposes</div>
                     <div class="line">to be a friar, from the time of his remembrance to</div>
                     <div class="line">this very instant disaster of his setting i' the</div>
                     <div class="line">stocks: and what think you he hath confessed?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing of me, has a'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">His confession is taken, and it shall be read to his</div>
                     <div class="line">face: if your lordship be in't, as I believe you</div>
                     <div class="line">are, you must have the patience to hear it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PAROLLES guarded, and First Soldier</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">A plague upon him! muffled! he can say nothing of</div>
                     <div class="line">me: hush, hush!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Hoodman comes! Portotartarosa</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">He calls for the tortures: what will you say</div>
                     <div class="line">without 'em?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I will confess what I know without constraint: if</div>
