                     <div class="line">ye pinch me like a pasty, I can say no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Bosko chimurcho.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Boblibindo chicurmurco.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">You are a merciful general. Our general bids you</div>
                     <div class="line">answer to what I shall ask you out of a note.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">And truly, as I hope to live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'First demand of him how many horse the</div>
                     <div class="line">duke is strong.' What say you to that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Five or six thousand; but very weak and</div>
                     <div class="line">unserviceable: the troops are all scattered, and</div>
                     <div class="line">the commanders very poor rogues, upon my reputation</div>
                     <div class="line">and credit and as I hope to live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I set down your answer so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Do: I'll take the sacrament on't, how and which way you will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">All's one to him. What a past-saving slave is this!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">You're deceived, my lord: this is Monsieur</div>
                     <div class="line">Parolles, the gallant militarist,--that was his own</div>
                     <div class="line">phrase,--that had the whole theoric of war in the</div>
                     <div class="line">knot of his scarf, and the practise in the chape of</div>
                     <div class="line">his dagger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I will never trust a man again for keeping his sword</div>
                     <div class="line">clean. nor believe he can have every thing in him</div>
                     <div class="line">by wearing his apparel neatly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, that's set down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Five or six thousand horse, I said,-- I will say</div>
                     <div class="line">true,--or thereabouts, set down, for I'll speak truth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">He's very near the truth in this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">But I con him no thanks for't, in the nature he</div>
                     <div class="line">delivers it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor rogues, I pray you, say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, that's set down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I humbly thank you, sir: a truth's a truth, the</div>
                     <div class="line">rogues are marvellous poor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Demand of him, of what strength they are</div>
                     <div class="line">a-foot.' What say you to that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, sir, if I were to live this present</div>
                     <div class="line">hour, I will tell true. Let me see: Spurio, a</div>
                     <div class="line">hundred and fifty; Sebastian, so many; Corambus, so</div>
                     <div class="line">many; Jaques, so many; Guiltian, Cosmo, Lodowick,</div>
                     <div class="line">and Gratii, two hundred and fifty each; mine own</div>
                     <div class="line">company, Chitopher, Vaumond, Bentii, two hundred and</div>
                     <div class="line">fifty each: so that the muster-file, rotten and</div>
                     <div class="line">sound, upon my life, amounts not to fifteen thousand</div>
                     <div class="line">poll; half of the which dare not shake snow from off</div>
                     <div class="line">their cassocks, lest they shake themselves to pieces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall be done to him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing, but let him have thanks. Demand of him my</div>
                     <div class="line">condition, and what credit I have with the duke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, that's set down.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'You shall demand of him, whether one Captain Dumain</div>
                     <div class="line">be i' the camp, a Frenchman; what his reputation is</div>
                     <div class="line">with the duke; what his valour, honesty, and</div>
                     <div class="line">expertness in wars; or whether he thinks it were not</div>
                     <div class="line">possible, with well-weighing sums of gold, to</div>
                     <div class="line">corrupt him to revolt.' What say you to this? what</div>
                     <div class="line">do you know of it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I beseech you, let me answer to the particular of</div>
                     <div class="line">the inter'gatories: demand them singly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you know this Captain Dumain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I know him: a' was a botcher's 'prentice in Paris,</div>
                     <div class="line">from whence he was whipped for getting the shrieve's</div>
                     <div class="line">fool with child,--a dumb innocent, that could not</div>
                     <div class="line">say him nay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, by your leave, hold your hands; though I know</div>
                     <div class="line">his brains are forfeit to the next tile that falls.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, is this captain in the duke of Florence's camp?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my knowledge, he is, and lousy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay look not so upon me; we shall hear of your</div>
                     <div class="line">lordship anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">What is his reputation with the duke?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">The duke knows him for no other but a poor officer</div>
                     <div class="line">of mine; and writ to me this other day to turn him</div>
                     <div class="line">out o' the band: I think I have his letter in my pocket.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, we'll search.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">In good sadness, I do not know; either it is there,</div>
                     <div class="line">or it is upon a file with the duke's other letters</div>
                     <div class="line">in my tent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Here 'tis; here's a paper: shall I read it to you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not know if it be it or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Our interpreter does it well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Excellently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Dian, the count's a fool, and full of gold,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">That is not the duke's letter, sir; that is an</div>
                     <div class="line">advertisement to a proper maid in Florence, one</div>
                     <div class="line">Diana, to take heed of the allurement of one Count</div>
                     <div class="line">Rousillon, a foolish idle boy, but for all that very</div>
                     <div class="line">ruttish: I pray you, sir, put it up again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I'll read it first, by your favour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">My meaning in't, I protest, was very honest in the</div>
                     <div class="line">behalf of the maid; for I knew the young count to be</div>
                     <div class="line">a dangerous and lascivious boy, who is a whale to</div>
                     <div class="line">virginity and devours up all the fry it finds.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Damnable both-sides rogue!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'When he swears oaths, bid him drop gold, and take it;</div>
                     <div class="line">After he scores, he never pays the score:</div>
                     <div class="line">Half won is match well made; match, and well make it;</div>
                     <div class="line">He ne'er pays after-debts, take it before;</div>
                     <div class="line">And say a soldier, Dian, told thee this,</div>
                     <div class="line">Men are to mell with, boys are not to kiss:</div>
                     <div class="line">For count of this, the count's a fool, I know it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who pays before, but not when he does owe it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thine, as he vowed to thee in thine ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">PAROLLES.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall be whipped through the army with this rhyme</div>
                     <div class="line">in's forehead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">This is your devoted friend, sir, the manifold</div>
                     <div class="line">linguist and the armipotent soldier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I could endure any thing before but a cat, and now</div>
                     <div class="line">he's a cat to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">I perceive, sir, by the general's looks, we shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">fain to hang you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">My life, sir, in any case: not that I am afraid to</div>
                     <div class="line">die; but that, my offences being many, I would</div>
                     <div class="line">repent out the remainder of nature: let me live,</div>
                     <div class="line">sir, in a dungeon, i' the stocks, or any where, so I may live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll see what may be done, so you confess freely;</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore, once more to this Captain Dumain: you</div>
                     <div class="line">have answered to his reputation with the duke and to</div>
                     <div class="line">his valour: what is his honesty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">He will steal, sir, an egg out of a cloister: for</div>
                     <div class="line">rapes and ravishments he parallels Nessus: he</div>
                     <div class="line">professes not keeping of oaths; in breaking 'em he</div>
                     <div class="line">is stronger than Hercules: he will lie, sir, with</div>
                     <div class="line">such volubility, that you would think truth were a</div>
                     <div class="line">fool: drunkenness is his best virtue, for he will</div>
                     <div class="line">be swine-drunk; and in his sleep he does little</div>
                     <div class="line">harm, save to his bed-clothes about him; but they</div>
                     <div class="line">know his conditions and lay him in straw. I have but</div>
                     <div class="line">little more to say, sir, of his honesty: he has</div>
                     <div class="line">every thing that an honest man should not have; what</div>
                     <div class="line">an honest man should have, he has nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">I begin to love him for this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">For this description of thine honesty? A pox upon</div>
                     <div class="line">him for me, he's more and more a cat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">What say you to his expertness in war?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, sir, he has led the drum before the English</div>
                     <div class="line">tragedians; to belie him, I will not, and more of</div>
                     <div class="line">his soldiership I know not; except, in that country</div>
                     <div class="line">he had the honour to be the officer at a place there</div>
                     <div class="line">called Mile-end, to instruct for the doubling of</div>
                     <div class="line">files: I would do the man what honour I can, but of</div>
                     <div class="line">this I am not certain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath out-villained villany so far, that the</div>
                     <div class="line">rarity redeems him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">A pox on him, he's a cat still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">His qualities being at this poor price, I need not</div>
                     <div class="line">to ask you if gold will corrupt him to revolt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, for a quart d'ecu he will sell the fee-simple</div>
                     <div class="line">of his salvation, the inheritance of it; and cut the</div>
                     <div class="line">entail from all remainders, and a perpetual</div>
                     <div class="line">succession for it perpetually.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">What's his brother, the other Captain Dumain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Why does be ask him of me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">What's he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">E'en a crow o' the same nest; not altogether so</div>
                     <div class="line">great as the first in goodness, but greater a great</div>
                     <div class="line">deal in evil: he excels his brother for a coward,</div>
                     <div class="line">yet his brother is reputed one of the best that is:</div>
                     <div class="line">in a retreat he outruns any lackey; marry, in coming</div>
                     <div class="line">on he has the cramp.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">If your life be saved, will you undertake to betray</div>
                     <div class="line">the Florentine?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and the captain of his horse, Count Rousillon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll whisper with the general, and know his pleasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  I'll no more drumming; a plague of all</div>
                     <div class="line">drums! Only to seem to deserve well, and to</div>
                     <div class="line">beguile the supposition of that lascivious young boy</div>
                     <div class="line">the count, have I run into this danger. Yet who</div>
                     <div class="line">would have suspected an ambush where I was taken?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no remedy, sir, but you must die: the</div>
                     <div class="line">general says, you that have so traitorously</div>
                     <div class="line">discovered the secrets of your army and made such</div>
                     <div class="line">pestiferous reports of men very nobly held, can</div>
                     <div class="line">serve the world for no honest use; therefore you</div>
                     <div class="line">must die. Come, headsman, off with his head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord, sir, let me live, or let me see my death!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall you, and take your leave of all your friends.</div>
                     <p>Unblinding him</p>
                     <div class="line">So, look about you: know you any here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, noble captain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">God bless you, Captain Parolles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">God save you, noble captain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Captain, what greeting will you to my Lord Lafeu?</div>
                     <div class="line">I am for France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Good captain, will you give me a copy of the sonnet</div>
                     <div class="line">you writ to Diana in behalf of the Count Rousillon?</div>
                     <div class="line">an I were not a very coward, I'ld compel it of you:</div>
                     <div class="line">but fare you well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt BERTRAM and Lords</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">You are undone, captain, all but your scarf; that</div>
                     <div class="line">has a knot on't yet</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Who cannot be crushed with a plot?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Soldier</div>
                     <div class="line">If you could find out a country where but women were</div>
                     <div class="line">that had received so much shame, you might begin an</div>
                     <div class="line">impudent nation. Fare ye well, sir; I am for France</div>
                     <div class="line">too: we shall speak of you there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit with Soldiers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet am I thankful: if my heart were great,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twould burst at this. Captain I'll be no more;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will eat and drink, and sleep as soft</div>
                     <div class="line">As captain shall: simply the thing I am</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall make me live. Who knows himself a braggart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him fear this, for it will come to pass</div>
                     <div class="line">that every braggart shall be found an ass.</div>
                     <div class="line">Rust, sword? cool, blushes! and, Parolles, live</div>
                     <div class="line">Safest in shame! being fool'd, by foolery thrive!</div>
                     <div class="line">There's place and means for every man alive.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll after them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Florence. The Widow's house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HELENA, Widow, and DIANA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">That you may well perceive I have not wrong'd you,</div>
                     <div class="line">One of the greatest in the Christian world</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be my surety; 'fore whose throne 'tis needful,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere I can perfect mine intents, to kneel:</div>
                     <div class="line">Time was, I did him a desired office,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear almost as his life; which gratitude</div>
                     <div class="line">Through flinty Tartar's bosom would peep forth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And answer, thanks: I duly am inform'd</div>
                     <div class="line">His grace is at Marseilles; to which place</div>
                     <div class="line">We have convenient convoy. You must know</div>
                     <div class="line">I am supposed dead: the army breaking,</div>
                     <div class="line">My husband hies him home; where, heaven aiding,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by the leave of my good lord the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll be before our welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentle madam,</div>
                     <div class="line">You never had a servant to whose trust</div>
                     <div class="line">Your business was more welcome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor you, mistress,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ever a friend whose thoughts more truly labour</div>
                     <div class="line">To recompense your love: doubt not but heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath brought me up to be your daughter's dower,</div>
                     <div class="line">As it hath fated her to be my motive</div>
                     <div class="line">And helper to a husband. But, O strange men!</div>
                     <div class="line">That can such sweet use make of what they hate,</div>
                     <div class="line">When saucy trusting of the cozen'd thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">Defiles the pitchy night: so lust doth play</div>
                     <div class="line">With what it loathes for that which is away.</div>
                     <div class="line">But more of this hereafter. You, Diana,</div>
                     <div class="line">Under my poor instructions yet must suffer</div>
                     <div class="line">Something in my behalf.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let death and honesty</div>
                     <div class="line">Go with your impositions, I am yours</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon your will to suffer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, I pray you:</div>
                     <div class="line">But with the word the time will bring on summer,</div>
                     <div class="line">When briers shall have leaves as well as thorns,</div>
                     <div class="line">And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;</div>
                     <div class="line">Our wagon is prepared, and time revives us:</div>
                     <div class="line">All's well that ends well; still the fine's the crown;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter COUNTESS, LAFEU, and Clown</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, no, your son was misled with a snipt-taffeta</div>
                     <div class="line">fellow there, whose villanous saffron would have</div>
                     <div class="line">made all the unbaked and doughy youth of a nation in</div>
                     <div class="line">his colour: your daughter-in-law had been alive at</div>
                     <div class="line">this hour, and your son here at home, more advanced</div>
                     <div class="line">by the king than by that red-tailed humble-bee I speak of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">I would I had not known him; it was the death of the</div>
                     <div class="line">most virtuous gentlewoman that ever nature had</div>
                     <div class="line">praise for creating. If she had partaken of my</div>
                     <div class="line">flesh, and cost me the dearest groans of a mother, I</div>
                     <div class="line">could not have owed her a more rooted love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas a good lady, 'twas a good lady: we may pick a</div>
                     <div class="line">thousand salads ere we light on such another herb.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, sir, she was the sweet marjoram of the</div>
                     <div class="line">salad, or rather, the herb of grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">They are not herbs, you knave; they are nose-herbs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I am no great Nebuchadnezzar, sir; I have not much</div>
                     <div class="line">skill in grass.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether dost thou profess thyself, a knave or a fool?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">A fool, sir, at a woman's service, and a knave at a man's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Your distinction?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I would cozen the man of his wife and do his service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">So you were a knave at his service, indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">And I would give his wife my bauble, sir, to do her service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">I will subscribe for thee, thou art both knave and fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">At your service.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, sir, if I cannot serve you, I can serve as</div>
                     <div class="line">great a prince as you are.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's that? a Frenchman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, sir, a' has an English name; but his fisnomy</div>
                     <div class="line">is more hotter in France than there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">What prince is that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">The black prince, sir; alias, the prince of</div>
                     <div class="line">darkness; alias, the devil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold thee, there's my purse: I give thee not this</div>
                     <div class="line">to suggest thee from thy master thou talkest of;</div>
                     <div class="line">serve him still.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a woodland fellow, sir, that always loved a</div>
                     <div class="line">great fire; and the master I speak of ever keeps a</div>
                     <div class="line">good fire. But, sure, he is the prince of the</div>
                     <div class="line">world; let his nobility remain in's court. I am for</div>
                     <div class="line">the house with the narrow gate, which I take to be</div>
                     <div class="line">too little for pomp to enter: some that humble</div>
                     <div class="line">themselves may; but the many will be too chill and</div>
                     <div class="line">tender, and they'll be for the flowery way that</div>
                     <div class="line">leads to the broad gate and the great fire.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Go thy ways, I begin to be aweary of thee; and I</div>
                     <div class="line">tell thee so before, because I would not fall out</div>
                     <div class="line">with thee. Go thy ways: let my horses be well</div>
                     <div class="line">looked to, without any tricks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">If I put any tricks upon 'em, sir, they shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">jades' tricks; which are their own right by the law of nature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">A shrewd knave and an unhappy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">So he is. My lord that's gone made himself much</div>
                     <div class="line">sport out of him: by his authority he remains here,</div>
                     <div class="line">which he thinks is a patent for his sauciness; and,</div>
                     <div class="line">indeed, he has no pace, but runs where he will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">I like him well; 'tis not amiss. And I was about to</div>
                     <div class="line">tell you, since I heard of the good lady's death and</div>
                     <div class="line">that my lord your son was upon his return home, I</div>
                     <div class="line">moved the king my master to speak in the behalf of</div>
                     <div class="line">my daughter; which, in the minority of them both,</div>
                     <div class="line">his majesty, out of a self-gracious remembrance, did</div>
                     <div class="line">first propose: his highness hath promised me to do</div>
                     <div class="line">it: and, to stop up the displeasure he hath</div>
                     <div class="line">conceived against your son, there is no fitter</div>
                     <div class="line">matter. How does your ladyship like it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">With very much content, my lord; and I wish it</div>
                     <div class="line">happily effected.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">His highness comes post from Marseilles, of as able</div>
                     <div class="line">body as when he numbered thirty: he will be here</div>
                     <div class="line">to-morrow, or I am deceived by him that in such</div>
                     <div class="line">intelligence hath seldom failed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">It rejoices me, that I hope I shall see him ere I</div>
                     <div class="line">die. I have letters that my son will be here</div>
                     <div class="line">to-night: I shall beseech your lordship to remain</div>
                     <div class="line">with me till they meet together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I was thinking with what manners I might</div>
                     <div class="line">safely be admitted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">You need but plead your honourable privilege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, of that I have made a bold charter; but I</div>
                     <div class="line">thank my God it holds yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter Clown</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">O madam, yonder's my lord your son with a patch of</div>
                     <div class="line">velvet on's face: whether there be a scar under't</div>
                     <div class="line">or no, the velvet knows; but 'tis a goodly patch of</div>
                     <div class="line">velvet: his left cheek is a cheek of two pile and a</div>
                     <div class="line">half, but his right cheek is worn bare.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">A scar nobly got, or a noble scar, is a good livery</div>
                     <div class="line">of honour; so belike is that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">But it is your carbonadoed face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us go see your son, I pray you: I long to talk</div>
                     <div class="line">with the young noble soldier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith there's a dozen of 'em, with delicate fine</div>
                     <div class="line">hats and most courteous feathers, which bow the head</div>
                     <div class="line">and nod at every man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Marseilles. A street.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Rousillon. Before the COUNT's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. EPILOGUE</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Marseilles. A street.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HELENA, Widow, and DIANA, with two
Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">But this exceeding posting day and night</div>
                     <div class="line">Must wear your spirits low; we cannot help it:</div>
                     <div class="line">But since you have made the days and nights as one,</div>
                     <div class="line">To wear your gentle limbs in my affairs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be bold you do so grow in my requital</div>
                     <div class="line">As nothing can unroot you. In happy time;</div>
                     <p>Enter a Gentleman</p>
                     <div class="line">This man may help me to his majesty's ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">If he would spend his power. God save you, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">And you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I have seen you in the court of France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">I have been sometimes there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">I do presume, sir, that you are not fallen</div>
                     <div class="line">From the report that goes upon your goodness;</div>
                     <div class="line">An therefore, goaded with most sharp occasions,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which lay nice manners by, I put you to</div>
                     <div class="line">The use of your own virtues, for the which</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall continue thankful.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">What's your will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">That it will please you</div>
                     <div class="line">To give this poor petition to the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">And aid me with that store of power you have</div>
                     <div class="line">To come into his presence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">The king's not here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not here, sir!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Not, indeed:</div>
                     <div class="line">He hence removed last night and with more haste</div>
                     <div class="line">Than is his use.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord, how we lose our pains!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">All's well that ends well yet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though time seem so adverse and means unfit.</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech you, whither is he gone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, as I take it, to Rousillon;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither I am going.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech you, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since you are like to see the king before me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Commend the paper to his gracious hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I presume shall render you no blame</div>
                     <div class="line">But rather make you thank your pains for it.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will come after you with what good speed</div>
                     <div class="line">Our means will make us means.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">This I'll do for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">And you shall find yourself to be well thank'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whate'er falls more. We must to horse again.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, go, provide.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Rousillon. Before the COUNT's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Clown, and PAROLLES, following</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Monsieur Lavache, give my Lord Lafeu this</div>
                     <div class="line">letter: I have ere now, sir, been better known to</div>
                     <div class="line">you, when I have held familiarity with fresher</div>
                     <div class="line">clothes; but I am now, sir, muddied in fortune's</div>
                     <div class="line">mood, and smell somewhat strong of her strong</div>
                     <div class="line">displeasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, fortune's displeasure is but sluttish, if it</div>
                     <div class="line">smell so strongly as thou speakest of: I will</div>
                     <div class="line">henceforth eat no fish of fortune's buttering.</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, allow the wind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, you need not to stop your nose, sir; I spake</div>
                     <div class="line">but by a metaphor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, sir, if your metaphor stink, I will stop my</div>
                     <div class="line">nose; or against any man's metaphor. Prithee, get</div>
                     <div class="line">thee further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, sir, deliver me this paper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Clown</div>
                     <div class="line">Foh! prithee, stand away: a paper from fortune's</div>
                     <div class="line">close-stool to give to a nobleman! Look, here he</div>
                     <div class="line">comes himself.</div>
                     <p>Enter LAFEU</p>
                     <div class="line">Here is a purr of fortune's, sir, or of fortune's</div>
                     <div class="line">cat,--but not a musk-cat,--that has fallen into the</div>
                     <div class="line">unclean fishpond of her displeasure, and, as he</div>
                     <div class="line">says, is muddied withal: pray you, sir, use the</div>
                     <div class="line">carp as you may; for he looks like a poor, decayed,</div>
                     <div class="line">ingenious, foolish, rascally knave. I do pity his</div>
                     <div class="line">distress in my similes of comfort and leave him to</div>
                     <div class="line">your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I am a man whom fortune hath cruelly</div>
                     <div class="line">scratched.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">And what would you have me to do? 'Tis too late to</div>
                     <div class="line">pare her nails now. Wherein have you played the</div>
                     <div class="line">knave with fortune, that she should scratch you, who</div>
                     <div class="line">of herself is a good lady and would not have knaves</div>
                     <div class="line">thrive long under her? There's a quart d'ecu for</div>
                     <div class="line">you: let the justices make you and fortune friends:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am for other business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I beseech your honour to hear me one single word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">You beg a single penny more: come, you shall ha't;</div>
                     <div class="line">save your word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">My name, my good lord, is Parolles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">You beg more than 'word,' then. Cox my passion!</div>
                     <div class="line">give me your hand. How does your drum?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">O my good lord, you were the first that found me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Was I, in sooth? and I was the first that lost thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">It lies in you, my lord, to bring me in some grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">for you did bring me out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Out upon thee, knave! dost thou put upon me at once</div>
                     <div class="line">both the office of God and the devil? One brings</div>
                     <div class="line">thee in grace and the other brings thee out.</div>
                     <p>Trumpets sound</p>
                     <div class="line">The king's coming; I know by his trumpets. Sirrah,</div>
                     <div class="line">inquire further after me; I had talk of you last</div>
                     <div class="line">night: though you are a fool and a knave, you shall</div>
                     <div class="line">eat; go to, follow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I praise God for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Enter KING, COUNTESS, LAFEU, the two
French Lords, with Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">We lost a jewel of her; and our esteem</div>
                     <div class="line">Was made much poorer by it: but your son,</div>
                     <div class="line">As mad in folly, lack'd the sense to know</div>
                     <div class="line">Her estimation home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis past, my liege;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I beseech your majesty to make it</div>
                     <div class="line">Natural rebellion, done i' the blaze of youth;</div>
                     <div class="line">When oil and fire, too strong for reason's force,</div>
                     <div class="line">O'erbears it and burns on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">My honour'd lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have forgiven and forgotten all;</div>
                     <div class="line">Though my revenges were high bent upon him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And watch'd the time to shoot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">This I must say,</div>
                     <div class="line">But first I beg my pardon, the young lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Did to his majesty, his mother and his lady</div>
                     <div class="line">Offence of mighty note; but to himself</div>
                     <div class="line">The greatest wrong of all. He lost a wife</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose beauty did astonish the survey</div>
                     <div class="line">Of richest eyes, whose words all ears took captive,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose dear perfection hearts that scorn'd to serve</div>
                     <div class="line">Humbly call'd mistress.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Praising what is lost</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes the remembrance dear. Well, call him hither;</div>
                     <div class="line">We are reconciled, and the first view shall kill</div>
                     <div class="line">All repetition: let him not ask our pardon;</div>
                     <div class="line">The nature of his great offence is dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">And deeper than oblivion we do bury</div>
                     <div class="line">The incensing relics of it: let him approach,</div>
                     <div class="line">A stranger, no offender; and inform him</div>
                     <div class="line">So 'tis our will he should.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall, my liege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">What says he to your daughter? have you spoke?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">All that he is hath reference to your highness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Then shall we have a match. I have letters sent me</div>
                     <div class="line">That set him high in fame.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BERTRAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">He looks well on't.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not a day of season,</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou mayst see a sunshine and a hail</div>
                     <div class="line">In me at once: but to the brightest beams</div>
                     <div class="line">Distracted clouds give way; so stand thou forth;</div>
                     <div class="line">The time is fair again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My high-repented blames,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear sovereign, pardon to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">All is whole;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not one word more of the consumed time.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's take the instant by the forward top;</div>
                     <div class="line">For we are old, and on our quick'st decrees</div>
                     <div class="line">The inaudible and noiseless foot of Time</div>
                     <div class="line">Steals ere we can effect them. You remember</div>
                     <div class="line">The daughter of this lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Admiringly, my liege, at first</div>
                     <div class="line">I stuck my choice upon her, ere my heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Durst make too bold a herald of my tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Where the impression of mine eye infixing,</div>
                     <div class="line">Contempt his scornful perspective did lend me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which warp'd the line of every other favour;</div>
                     <div class="line">Scorn'd a fair colour, or express'd it stolen;</div>
                     <div class="line">Extended or contracted all proportions</div>
                     <div class="line">To a most hideous object: thence it came</div>
                     <div class="line">That she whom all men praised and whom myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since I have lost, have loved, was in mine eye</div>
                     <div class="line">The dust that did offend it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Well excused:</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou didst love her, strikes some scores away</div>
                     <div class="line">From the great compt: but love that comes too late,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a remorseful pardon slowly carried,</div>
                     <div class="line">To the great sender turns a sour offence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Crying, 'That's good that's gone.' Our rash faults</div>
                     <div class="line">Make trivial price of serious things we have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not knowing them until we know their grave:</div>
                     <div class="line">Oft our displeasures, to ourselves unjust,</div>
                     <div class="line">Destroy our friends and after weep their dust</div>
                     <div class="line">Our own love waking cries to see what's done,</div>
                     <div class="line">While shame full late sleeps out the afternoon.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be this sweet Helen's knell, and now forget her.</div>
                     <div class="line">Send forth your amorous token for fair Maudlin:</div>
                     <div class="line">The main consents are had; and here we'll stay</div>
                     <div class="line">To see our widower's second marriage-day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Which better than the first, O dear heaven, bless!</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, ere they meet, in me, O nature, cesse!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
