               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Come on, my son, in whom my house's name</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be digested, give a favour from you</div>
                     <div class="line">To sparkle in the spirits of my daughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she may quickly come.</div>
                     <p>BERTRAM gives a ring</p>
                     <div class="line">By my old beard,</div>
                     <div class="line">And every hair that's on't, Helen, that's dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was a sweet creature: such a ring as this,</div>
                     <div class="line">The last that e'er I took her at court,</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw upon her finger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Hers it was not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, pray you, let me see it; for mine eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">While I was speaking, oft was fasten'd to't.</div>
                     <div class="line">This ring was mine; and, when I gave it Helen,</div>
                     <div class="line">I bade her, if her fortunes ever stood</div>
                     <div class="line">Necessitied to help, that by this token</div>
                     <div class="line">I would relieve her. Had you that craft, to reave</div>
                     <div class="line">her</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what should stead her most?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">Howe'er it pleases you to take it so,</div>
                     <div class="line">The ring was never hers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Son, on my life,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have seen her wear it; and she reckon'd it</div>
                     <div class="line">At her life's rate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sure I saw her wear it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">You are deceived, my lord; she never saw it:</div>
                     <div class="line">In Florence was it from a casement thrown me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wrapp'd in a paper, which contain'd the name</div>
                     <div class="line">Of her that threw it: noble she was, and thought</div>
                     <div class="line">I stood engaged: but when I had subscribed</div>
                     <div class="line">To mine own fortune and inform'd her fully</div>
                     <div class="line">I could not answer in that course of honour</div>
                     <div class="line">As she had made the overture, she ceased</div>
                     <div class="line">In heavy satisfaction and would never</div>
                     <div class="line">Receive the ring again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Plutus himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">That knows the tinct and multiplying medicine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath not in nature's mystery more science</div>
                     <div class="line">Than I have in this ring: 'twas mine, 'twas Helen's,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whoever gave it you. Then, if you know</div>
                     <div class="line">That you are well acquainted with yourself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Confess 'twas hers, and by what rough enforcement</div>
                     <div class="line">You got it from her: she call'd the saints to surety</div>
                     <div class="line">That she would never put it from her finger,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless she gave it to yourself in bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you have never come, or sent it us</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon her great disaster.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">She never saw it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou speak'st it falsely, as I love mine honour;</div>
                     <div class="line">And makest conjectural fears to come into me</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I would fain shut out. If it should prove</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou art so inhuman,--'twill not prove so;--</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I know not: thou didst hate her deadly,</div>
                     <div class="line">And she is dead; which nothing, but to close</div>
                     <div class="line">Her eyes myself, could win me to believe,</div>
                     <div class="line">More than to see this ring. Take him away.</div>
                     <p>Guards seize BERTRAM</p>
                     <div class="line">My fore-past proofs, howe'er the matter fall,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall tax my fears of little vanity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Having vainly fear'd too little. Away with him!</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll sift this matter further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">If you shall prove</div>
                     <div class="line">This ring was ever hers, you shall as easy</div>
                     <div class="line">Prove that I husbanded her bed in Florence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where yet she never was.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit, guarded</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">I am wrapp'd in dismal thinkings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Gentleman</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Gracious sovereign,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether I have been to blame or no, I know not:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's a petition from a Florentine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who hath for four or five removes come short</div>
                     <div class="line">To tender it herself. I undertook it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Vanquish'd thereto by the fair grace and speech</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the poor suppliant, who by this I know</div>
                     <div class="line">Is here attending: her business looks in her</div>
                     <div class="line">With an importing visage; and she told me,</div>
                     <div class="line">In a sweet verbal brief, it did concern</div>
                     <div class="line">Your highness with herself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  Upon his many protestations to marry me</div>
                     <div class="line">when his wife was dead, I blush to say it, he won</div>
                     <div class="line">me. Now is the Count Rousillon a widower: his vows</div>
                     <div class="line">are forfeited to me, and my honour's paid to him. He</div>
                     <div class="line">stole from Florence, taking no leave, and I follow</div>
                     <div class="line">him to his country for justice: grant it me, O</div>
                     <div class="line">king! in you it best lies; otherwise a seducer</div>
                     <div class="line">flourishes, and a poor maid is undone.</div>
                     <div class="line">DIANA CAPILET.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">I will buy me a son-in-law in a fair, and toll for</div>
                     <div class="line">this: I'll none of him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">The heavens have thought well on thee Lafeu,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring forth this discovery. Seek these suitors:</div>
                     <div class="line">Go speedily and bring again the count.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am afeard the life of Helen, lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was foully snatch'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, justice on the doers!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter BERTRAM, guarded</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">I wonder, sir, sith wives are monsters to you,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that you fly them as you swear them lordship,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet you desire to marry.</div>
                     <p>Enter Widow and DIANA</p>
                     <div class="line">What woman's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am, my lord, a wretched Florentine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Derived from the ancient Capilet:</div>
                     <div class="line">My suit, as I do understand, you know,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore know how far I may be pitied.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Widow</div>
                     <div class="line">I am her mother, sir, whose age and honour</div>
                     <div class="line">Both suffer under this complaint we bring,</div>
                     <div class="line">And both shall cease, without your remedy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, count; do you know these women?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I neither can nor will deny</div>
                     <div class="line">But that I know them: do they charge me further?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why do you look so strange upon your wife?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">She's none of mine, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">If you shall marry,</div>
                     <div class="line">You give away this hand, and that is mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">You give away heaven's vows, and those are mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">You give away myself, which is known mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I by vow am so embodied yours,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she which marries you must marry me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Either both or none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Your reputation comes too short for my daughter; you</div>
                     <div class="line">are no husband for her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, this is a fond and desperate creature,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom sometime I have laugh'd with: let your highness</div>
                     <div class="line">Lay a more noble thought upon mine honour</div>
                     <div class="line">Than for to think that I would sink it here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, for my thoughts, you have them ill to friend</div>
                     <div class="line">Till your deeds gain them: fairer prove your honour</div>
                     <div class="line">Than in my thought it lies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ask him upon his oath, if he does think</div>
                     <div class="line">He had not my virginity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou to her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">She's impudent, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">And was a common gamester to the camp.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">He does me wrong, my lord; if I were so,</div>
                     <div class="line">He might have bought me at a common price:</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not believe him. O, behold this ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose high respect and rich validity</div>
                     <div class="line">Did lack a parallel; yet for all that</div>
                     <div class="line">He gave it to a commoner o' the camp,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I be one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                     <div class="line">He blushes, and 'tis it:</div>
                     <div class="line">Of six preceding ancestors, that gem,</div>
                     <div class="line">Conferr'd by testament to the sequent issue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath it been owed and worn. This is his wife;</div>
                     <div class="line">That ring's a thousand proofs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought you said</div>
                     <div class="line">You saw one here in court could witness it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I did, my lord, but loath am to produce</div>
                     <div class="line">So bad an instrument: his name's Parolles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw the man to-day, if man he be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Find him, and bring him hither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit an Attendant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What of him?</div>
                     <div class="line">He's quoted for a most perfidious slave,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all the spots o' the world tax'd and debosh'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose nature sickens but to speak a truth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I or that or this for what he'll utter,</div>
                     <div class="line">That will speak any thing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">She hath that ring of yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I think she has: certain it is I liked her,</div>
                     <div class="line">And boarded her i' the wanton way of youth:</div>
                     <div class="line">She knew her distance and did angle for me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Madding my eagerness with her restraint,</div>
                     <div class="line">As all impediments in fancy's course</div>
                     <div class="line">Are motives of more fancy; and, in fine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her infinite cunning, with her modern grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Subdued me to her rate: she got the ring;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I had that which any inferior might</div>
                     <div class="line">At market-price have bought.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I must be patient:</div>
                     <div class="line">You, that have turn'd off a first so noble wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">May justly diet me. I pray you yet;</div>
                     <div class="line">Since you lack virtue, I will lose a husband;</div>
                     <div class="line">Send for your ring, I will return it home,</div>
                     <div class="line">And give me mine again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I have it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">What ring was yours, I pray you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, much like</div>
                     <div class="line">The same upon your finger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Know you this ring? this ring was his of late.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">And this was it I gave him, being abed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">The story then goes false, you threw it him</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of a casement.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I have spoke the truth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PAROLLES</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I do confess the ring was hers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">You boggle shrewdly, every feather stars you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this the man you speak of?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me, sirrah, but tell me true, I charge you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not fearing the displeasure of your master,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which on your just proceeding I'll keep off,</div>
                     <div class="line">By him and by this woman here what know you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">So please your majesty, my master hath been an</div>
                     <div class="line">honourable gentleman: tricks he hath had in him,</div>
                     <div class="line">which gentlemen have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, to the purpose: did he love this woman?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, sir, he did love her; but how?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">How, I pray you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">He did love her, sir, as a gentleman loves a woman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">How is that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">He loved her, sir, and loved her not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou art a knave, and no knave. What an</div>
                     <div class="line">equivocal companion is this!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a poor man, and at your majesty's command.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">He's a good drum, my lord, but a naughty orator.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you know he promised me marriage?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, I know more than I'll speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">But wilt thou not speak all thou knowest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, so please your majesty. I did go between them,</div>
                     <div class="line">as I said; but more than that, he loved her: for</div>
                     <div class="line">indeed he was mad for her, and talked of Satan and</div>
                     <div class="line">of Limbo and of Furies and I know not what: yet I</div>
                     <div class="line">was in that credit with them at that time that I</div>
                     <div class="line">knew of their going to bed, and of other motions,</div>
                     <div class="line">as promising her marriage, and things which would</div>
                     <div class="line">derive me ill will to speak of; therefore I will not</div>
                     <div class="line">speak what I know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast spoken all already, unless thou canst say</div>
                     <div class="line">they are married: but thou art too fine in thy</div>
                     <div class="line">evidence; therefore stand aside.</div>
                     <div class="line">This ring, you say, was yours?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my good lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Where did you buy it? or who gave it you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">It was not given me, nor I did not buy it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Who lent it you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">It was not lent me neither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Where did you find it, then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I found it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">If it were yours by none of all these ways,</div>
                     <div class="line">How could you give it him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I never gave it him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">This woman's an easy glove, my lord; she goes off</div>
                     <div class="line">and on at pleasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">This ring was mine; I gave it his first wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">It might be yours or hers, for aught I know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Take her away; I do not like her now;</div>
                     <div class="line">To prison with her: and away with him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless thou tell'st me where thou hadst this ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou diest within this hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll never tell you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Take her away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll put in bail, my liege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">I think thee now some common customer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">By Jove, if ever I knew man, 'twas you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherefore hast thou accused him all this while?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Because he's guilty, and he is not guilty:</div>
                     <div class="line">He knows I am no maid, and he'll swear to't;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll swear I am a maid, and he knows not.</div>
                     <div class="line">Great king, I am no strumpet, by my life;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am either maid, or else this old man's wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">She does abuse our ears: to prison with her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good mother, fetch my bail. Stay, royal sir:</div>
                     <p>Exit Widow</p>
                     <div class="line">The jeweller that owes the ring is sent for,</div>
                     <div class="line">And he shall surety me. But for this lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who hath abused me, as he knows himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though yet he never harm'd me, here I quit him:</div>
                     <div class="line">He knows himself my bed he hath defiled;</div>
                     <div class="line">And at that time he got his wife with child:</div>
                     <div class="line">Dead though she be, she feels her young one kick:</div>
                     <div class="line">So there's my riddle: one that's dead is quick:</div>
                     <div class="line">And now behold the meaning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter Widow, with HELENA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Is there no exorcist</div>
                     <div class="line">Beguiles the truer office of mine eyes?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't real that I see?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my good lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis but the shadow of a wife you see,</div>
                     <div class="line">The name and not the thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Both, both. O, pardon!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">O my good lord, when I was like this maid,</div>
                     <div class="line">I found you wondrous kind. There is your ring;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, look you, here's your letter; this it says:</div>
                     <div class="line">'When from my finger you can get this ring</div>
                     <div class="line">And are by me with child,' &c. This is done:</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you be mine, now you are doubly won?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                     <div class="line">If she, my liege, can make me know this clearly,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll love her dearly, ever, ever dearly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                     <div class="line">If it appear not plain and prove untrue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deadly divorce step between me and you!</div>
                     <div class="line">O my dear mother, do I see you living?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine eyes smell onions; I shall weep anon:</div>
                     <p>To PAROLLES</p>
                     <div class="line">Good Tom Drum, lend me a handkercher: so,</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank thee: wait on me home, I'll make sport with thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let thy courtesies alone, they are scurvy ones.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us from point to point this story know,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make the even truth in pleasure flow.</div>
                     <p>To DIANA</p>
                     <div class="line">If thou be'st yet a fresh uncropped flower,</div>
                     <div class="line">Choose thou thy husband, and I'll pay thy dower;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I can guess that by thy honest aid</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou keep'st a wife herself, thyself a maid.</div>
                     <div class="line">Of that and all the progress, more or less,</div>
                     <div class="line">Resolvedly more leisure shall express:</div>
                     <div class="line">All yet seems well; and if it end so meet,</div>
                     <div class="line">The bitter past, more welcome is the sweet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. EPILOGUE</h2>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING</div>
                     <div class="line">The king's a beggar, now the play is done:</div>
                     <div class="line">All is well ended, if this suit be won,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you express content; which we will pay,</div>
                     <div class="line">With strife to please you, day exceeding day:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ours be your patience then, and yours our parts;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your gentle hands lend us, and take our hearts.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>
<html>
   <head>
      <link href="../../resources/css/db-prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/default.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <meta charset="utf-8"/>
      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>All's Well That Ends Well</title>
   </head>
   <body>
      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>All's Well That Ends Well</h1>
         </header>

                           </span>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>

                           </span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  Rousillon. Before the COUNT's palace.</a>
                           </span>

         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">KING OF FRANCE</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DUKE OF FLORENCE</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BERTRAM, Count of Rousillon.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LAFEU, an old lord.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PAROLLES, a follower of Bertram.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">Steward</span>
                              <span class="personname">Clown</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">servants to the Countess of Rousillon.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Page. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">COUNTESS OF ROUSILLON, mother to Bertram. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">HELENA, a gentlewoman protected by the Countess.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">An old Widow of Florence. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DIANA, daughter to the Widow.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">VIOLENTA</span>
                              <span class="personname">MARIANA</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">neighbours and friends to the Widow.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Lords, Officers, Soldiers, &c., French and Florentine.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Rousillon; Paris; Florence; Marseilles.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  Paris. The KING's palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter BERTRAM, the COUNTESS of Rousillon, HELENA,
and LAFEU, all in black</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                              <div class="line">In delivering my son from me, I bury a second husband.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                              <div class="line">And I in going, madam, weep o'er my father's death</div>
                              <div class="line">anew: but I must attend his majesty's command, to</div>
                              <div class="line">whom I am now in ward, evermore in subjection.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall find of the king a husband, madam; you,</div>
                              <div class="line">sir, a father: he that so generally is at all times</div>
                              <div class="line">good must of necessity hold his virtue to you; whose</div>
                              <div class="line">worthiness would stir it up where it wanted rather</div>
                              <div class="line">than lack it where there is such abundance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                              <div class="line">What hope is there of his majesty's amendment?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath abandoned his physicians, madam; under whose</div>
                              <div class="line">practises he hath persecuted time with hope, and</div>
                              <div class="line">finds no other advantage in the process but only the</div>
                              <div class="line">losing of hope by time.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                              <div class="line">This young gentlewoman had a father,--O, that</div>
                              <div class="line">'had'! how sad a passage 'tis!--whose skill was</div>
                              <div class="line">almost as great as his honesty; had it stretched so</div>
                              <div class="line">far, would have made nature immortal, and death</div>
                              <div class="line">should have play for lack of work. Would, for the</div>
                              <div class="line">king's sake, he were living! I think it would be</div>
                              <div class="line">the death of the king's disease.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">How called you the man you speak of, madam?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                              <div class="line">He was famous, sir, in his profession, and it was</div>
                              <div class="line">his great right to be so: Gerard de Narbon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">He was excellent indeed, madam: the king very</div>
                              <div class="line">lately spoke of him admiringly and mourningly: he</div>
                              <div class="line">was skilful enough to have lived still, if knowledge</div>
                              <div class="line">could be set up against mortality.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                              <div class="line">What is it, my good lord, the king languishes of?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">A fistula, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                              <div class="line">I heard not of it before.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">I would it were not notorious. Was this gentlewoman</div>
                              <div class="line">the daughter of Gerard de Narbon?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                              <div class="line">His sole child, my lord, and bequeathed to my</div>
                              <div class="line">overlooking. I have those hopes of her good that</div>
                              <div class="line">her education promises; her dispositions she</div>
                              <div class="line">inherits, which makes fair gifts fairer; for where</div>
                              <div class="line">an unclean mind carries virtuous qualities, there</div>
                              <div class="line">commendations go with pity; they are virtues and</div>
                              <div class="line">traitors too; in her they are the better for their</div>
                              <div class="line">simpleness; she derives her honesty and achieves her goodness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">Your commendations, madam, get from her tears.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis the best brine a maiden can season her praise</div>
                              <div class="line">in. The remembrance of her father never approaches</div>
                              <div class="line">her heart but the tyranny of her sorrows takes all</div>
                              <div class="line">livelihood from her cheek. No more of this, Helena;</div>
                              <div class="line">go to, no more; lest it be rather thought you affect</div>
                              <div class="line">a sorrow than have it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">I do affect a sorrow indeed, but I have it too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">Moderate lamentation is the right of the dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">excessive grief the enemy to the living.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                              <div class="line">If the living be enemy to the grief, the excess</div>
                              <div class="line">makes it soon mortal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, I desire your holy wishes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">How understand we that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                              <div class="line">Be thou blest, Bertram, and succeed thy father</div>
                              <div class="line">In manners, as in shape! thy blood and virtue</div>
                              <div class="line">Contend for empire in thee, and thy goodness</div>
                              <div class="line">Share with thy birthright! Love all, trust a few,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do wrong to none: be able for thine enemy</div>
                              <div class="line">Rather in power than use, and keep thy friend</div>
                              <div class="line">Under thy own life's key: be cheque'd for silence,</div>
                              <div class="line">But never tax'd for speech. What heaven more will,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thee may furnish and my prayers pluck down,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fall on thy head! Farewell, my lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis an unseason'd courtier; good my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Advise him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">He cannot want the best</div>
                              <div class="line">That shall attend his love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COUNTESS</div>
                              <div class="line">Heaven bless him! Farewell, Bertram.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BERTRAM</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To HELENA</span>  The best wishes that can be forged in</div>
                              <div class="line">your thoughts be servants to you! Be comfortable</div>
                              <div class="line">to my mother, your mistress, and make much of her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAFEU</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell, pretty lady: you must hold the credit of</div>
                              <div class="line">your father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt BERTRAM and LAFEU</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">O, were that all! I think not on my father;</div>
                              <div class="line">And these great tears grace his remembrance more</div>
                              <div class="line">Than those I shed for him. What was he like?</div>
                              <div class="line">I have forgot him: my imagination</div>
                              <div class="line">Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am undone: there is no living, none,</div>
                              <div class="line">If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one</div>
                              <div class="line">That I should love a bright particular star</div>
                              <div class="line">And think to wed it, he is so above me:</div>
                              <div class="line">In his bright radiance and collateral light</div>
                              <div class="line">Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.</div>
                              <div class="line">The ambition in my love thus plagues itself:</div>
                              <div class="line">The hind that would be mated by the lion</div>
                              <div class="line">Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though plague,</div>
                              <div class="line">To see him every hour; to sit and draw</div>
                              <div class="line">His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,</div>
                              <div class="line">In our heart's table; heart too capable</div>
                              <div class="line">Of every line and trick of his sweet favour:</div>
                              <div class="line">But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy</div>
                              <div class="line">Must sanctify his reliques. Who comes here?</div>
                              <p>Enter PAROLLES</p>
                              <p>Aside</p>
                              <div class="line">One that goes with him: I love him for his sake;</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet I know him a notorious liar,</div>
                              <div class="line">Think him a great way fool, solely a coward;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet these fixed evils sit so fit in him,</div>
                              <div class="line">That they take place, when virtue's steely bones</div>
                              <div class="line">Look bleak i' the cold wind: withal, full oft we see</div>
                              <div class="line">Cold wisdom waiting on superfluous folly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Save you, fair queen!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">And you, monarch!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">No.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">And no.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you meditating on virginity?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay. You have some stain of soldier in you: let me</div>
                              <div class="line">ask you a question. Man is enemy to virginity; how</div>
                              <div class="line">may we barricado it against him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Keep him out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">But he assails; and our virginity, though valiant,</div>
                              <div class="line">in the defence yet is weak: unfold to us some</div>
                              <div class="line">warlike resistance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">There is none: man, sitting down before you, will</div>
                              <div class="line">undermine you and blow you up.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">Bless our poor virginity from underminers and</div>
                              <div class="line">blowers up! Is there no military policy, how</div>
                              <div class="line">virgins might blow up men?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Virginity being blown down, man will quicklier be</div>
                              <div class="line">blown up: marry, in blowing him down again, with</div>
                              <div class="line">the breach yourselves made, you lose your city. It</div>
                              <div class="line">is not politic in the commonwealth of nature to</div>
                              <div class="line">preserve virginity. Loss of virginity is rational</div>
                              <div class="line">increase and there was never virgin got till</div>
                              <div class="line">virginity was first lost. That you were made of is</div>
                              <div class="line">metal to make virgins. Virginity by being once lost</div>
                              <div class="line">may be ten times found; by being ever kept, it is</div>
                              <div class="line">ever lost: 'tis too cold a companion; away with 't!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">I will stand for 't a little, though therefore I die a virgin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">There's little can be said in 't; 'tis against the</div>
                              <div class="line">rule of nature. To speak on the part of virginity,</div>
                              <div class="line">is to accuse your mothers; which is most infallible</div>
                              <div class="line">disobedience. He that hangs himself is a virgin:</div>
                              <div class="line">virginity murders itself and should be buried in</div>
                              <div class="line">highways out of all sanctified limit, as a desperate</div>
                              <div class="line">offendress against nature. Virginity breeds mites,</div>
                              <div class="line">much like a cheese; consumes itself to the very</div>
                              <div class="line">paring, and so dies with feeding his own stomach.</div>
                              <div class="line">Besides, virginity is peevish, proud, idle, made of</div>
                              <div class="line">self-love, which is the most inhibited sin in the</div>
                              <div class="line">canon. Keep it not; you cannot choose but loose</div>
                              <div class="line">by't: out with 't! within ten year it will make</div>
                              <div class="line">itself ten, which is a goodly increase; and the</div>
                              <div class="line">principal itself not much the worse: away with 't!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">How might one do, sir, to lose it to her own liking?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me see: marry, ill, to like him that ne'er it</div>
                              <div class="line">likes. 'Tis a commodity will lose the gloss with</div>
                              <div class="line">lying; the longer kept, the less worth: off with 't</div>
                              <div class="line">while 'tis vendible; answer the time of request.</div>
                              <div class="line">Virginity, like an old courtier, wears her cap out</div>
                              <div class="line">of fashion: richly suited, but unsuitable: just</div>
                              <div class="line">like the brooch and the tooth-pick, which wear not</div>
                              <div class="line">now. Your date is better in your pie and your</div>
                              <div class="line">porridge than in your cheek; and your virginity,</div>
                              <div class="line">your old virginity, is like one of our French</div>
                              <div class="line">withered pears, it looks ill, it eats drily; marry,</div>
                              <div class="line">'tis a withered pear; it was formerly better;</div>
                              <div class="line">marry, yet 'tis a withered pear: will you anything with it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">Not my virginity yet</div>
                              <div class="line">There shall your master have a thousand loves,</div>
                              <div class="line">A mother and a mistress and a friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">A phoenix, captain and an enemy,</div>
                              <div class="line">A guide, a goddess, and a sovereign,</div>
                              <div class="line">A counsellor, a traitress, and a dear;</div>
                              <div class="line">His humble ambition, proud humility,</div>
                              <div class="line">His jarring concord, and his discord dulcet,</div>
                              <div class="line">His faith, his sweet disaster; with a world</div>
                              <div class="line">Of pretty, fond, adoptious christendoms,</div>
                              <div class="line">That blinking Cupid gossips. Now shall he--</div>
                              <div class="line">I know not what he shall. God send him well!</div>
                              <div class="line">The court's a learning place, and he is one--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What one, i' faith?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">That I wish well. 'Tis pity--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">What's pity?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">That wishing well had not a body in't,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Might with effects of them follow our friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">And show what we alone must think, which never</div>
                              <div class="line">Return us thanks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Page</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                              <div class="line">Monsieur Parolles, my lord calls for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Little Helen, farewell; if I can remember thee, I</div>
                              <div class="line">will think of thee at court.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">Monsieur Parolles, you were born under a charitable star.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Under Mars, I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
                              <div class="line">I especially think, under Mars.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PAROLLES</div>
                              <div class="line">Why under Mars?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HELENA</div>
